How To Save The World is not only an adaptation of a masterpiece - it is a play that marks the beginning of a world of infinite possibilities through self-discovery, authentic passion, and a genuine belief in an ideal world. By contributing, you will aid us in eradicating a world so devoid of hope, that the only cry of resilience we can muster is 'that is the way it is', and you will bring us closer towards the great beyond of our generation.It starts now - help us save the world.Our excellent cast, from left to right: Archie Brown, Beatrice Olivier, Shavariya Padayachee, Patrick Bayele, Alfie Noble, Maria Messias Mendes, Rosie Hodgson and James Garnham. What We Need & What You GetRedgates and Pat On The Back - partners in crime!As the project has progressed, our total expenditure stands at an estimate of £9680. Whilst this was initially larger, it has been due to the good will of our associates and collaborators who have offered additional services or provided their assistance with little to no charge that the overall cost has decreased. Their contribution is invaluable to us, and will always be remembered.  A substantial amount of capital has been amassed personally over the years, and this capital will be used to pay cast members and collaborating practitioners. With this page, we are asking for £1500 to help cover what reaches outside of our own pockets. However, as we have applied for further funding from other sources, we are launching this indiegogo not only to meet the demands of the production, but also to involve you, our audience, in its creation, so we can all truly develop a universal story and mould an everlasting cultural staple for everyone. Through this page, we aim to cover the cost of certain expenditures, those being:
The cost of making our play accessible (hiring extra chairs, props and platforms) (£1000).
Paying the salaries of technicians (£350).
Acquiring props (£150).
Studio 9294 - great, right?We need your help to make this show the best it can be. We do not want to make a loss, cut elements from the show, compromise the longevity of the show, or reduce the salaries of our team. We really need your help to ensure that this production is as professional as it can be, and that it maximises its full potential in curating the careers of our young, emerging talent, whilst gaining longevity through national and international tours. Even though we are new to the realm of professional theatre-making, we are confident that our voice and our story is compelling. Your contributions ensure that this show goes up as seamlessly and gracefully as possible. This aids us in planning our next step with the play through collaborating with professional theatre-makers and donors. This is your show as much as it is ours, and your contributions assure that this play embarks on a successful future through tours, research and development, and international recognition.Firstly, we'll be giving back to our audience through our Post-Show Q+A hosted by Terri Paddock on the 31st of July, the former editor of What'sOnStage, and the founder of MyTheatreMates, an excellent forum for independent theatre and journalism. You will be enriched, informed, enlightened and entertained as we; explore what the play means, reveal and share different insights into the story, discuss the challenges we had to face in its creation, articulate our intention in telling this story, chinwag over the play's future, and just have a laugh in general! Outside of this Q+A, donors will be rewarded not only with our utmost and sincere gratitude, but also with landmark materials from the play's production process. We have three tiers: Awesome Donors, Premium Donors and Badass Donors! Our Badass tier will be uploaded as the show approaches...Premium donors who contribute £50 or more will receive: 

Deluxe copies of the script - Copies of our technical scripts in all the different draft versions, with amendments and notes, all signed by every member of our cast - they'll be worth a pretty penny in the future! This also includes Blessed They Be Damned, the very play which Keira, the protagonist, writes for the London Student Drama Festival, the competition she is driven to win throughout the story. That's all we'll say on that; we really have gone the extra mile to make this story as brilliant as possible!

Blueprints of the play - Have you wondered how actors become their characters? Have you ever been curious about what goes on in rehearsal rooms? How on earth did we create How To Save The World? This blueprint will give you all the answers and so, so much more. These USB blueprints contain around 30 hours of improvisations and thought-tracking exercises that enabled us to create these characters. Our script was written out of improvised scenes and exercises, and these blueprints grant you unrivalled access to our process. You can witness how the script and the characters have been brought to life over the past 5 months, day by day. These blueprints even contain footage of scenes that took place before the events of the play - a whole new play in its own right! They also contain the moodboards, concepts, documents and all the promotional materials we have developed - even the stuff we didn't decide to use! It's the closest thing we can do to giving you our brains.

 Badass donors who contribute £100 or more will receive: 

Luxury packages - You will receive free tickets to our show and other shows, paid-for dining, and an invite to our private post-show party. Let us bring you into the world of London youth theatre with a toast to celebrate your arrival!

Involvement in our next show - If you donate £200, you will have an active say in what show we stage next. Whether you're acting, producing, writing, composing, directing - you can become one of us, right here, right now. Join us on the frontline in the war for a greater reality and have your visions come to life. We were born to create - you'll never look back!
Look at how badass we are - contribute £200 to join the squad!!!If we don't reach our all-or-nothing target, all the funds will be sent back to you. In such a situation, it'll take us a good few months to recover from losses, and this may stall or hinder the progression of the play. However, our cast is determined to ensure that any funding that can be secured is sought for. Your contributions will ensure that we avoid making any major losses, and will prevent us from having compromise on professionalism, accessibility and quality. Anything you can contribute will put our show in a better position for development in the future, and will ensure that this play lives on. If you help us reach our goal, your donations will ensure that our play will be an emblem of true artistic quality, and you will be at the centre of a creative revolution. This is it - the time is now!The ImpactI feel like this play has been in production subconsciously for almost a decade, as the sudden loss of my oldest brother, Anthony, in 2012, shattered my outlook on life. Ever since then, I have been re-building myself, nurturing my true identity through mourning and life experience. Now, this play has become more real than I even anticipated, and nothing, absolutely nothing, will come in the way of bringing this story to life, not only for myself, or for all of us, but for Anthony Bayele. This play is made for you, and could change everything. This play was meant to happen - and we want nothing more than for you to be apart of it.  Our project is valuable because it encompasses so many identities, experiences, issues, plights and human behaviours, that it connects all of us through the little things that all of us share. There are so many discoveries to be made in this play, so many personal revelations to be unearthed, it truly is a story for our times. You will experience an uncompromisingly and profoundly real, harrowing and tender tale, whilst also slapping your knee over laugh-out-loud, hilarious dialogue which you simply cannot make up. Our play is a play like no other. All of this drama is connected with choreography, movement and lighting, which all coalesce to make an awe-inspiring, unforgettable experience, leaving you yearning to pursue your greatest passions, whatever they may be.  My brother - who I dedicate this play to.You will be inspired to; tap into your vocation; discard your inner-critic, your fears of judgement, and your need to compare yourself to others; and locate your true self and carve your destiny out of growth, learning, faith and compassion. The play will make you see things differently, and most importantly, you will see yourself differently. You are in the play as much as we are, and we are pushing the boundaries of storytelling in order to immerse you in this poetic world as fully as possible, so you can leave the auditorium with a clearer vision of your ideal self, driven to make the world a better place. If you buy a ticket or donate, you will be contributing towards a play that gives us the grace to be who we are. This play is about all of us - and those who contribute in any way will be contributing to the growth of a new generation, a generation built on equality, acceptance, love, passion, art, and most importantly, hope. Risks & ChallengesThis play has become a challenge unto life itself, in more ways than we could foresee. We are all graduates who work in paid jobs, have far-branching expertise in different theatre fields and are familiar with theatre producing (many Queen Mary Students perform at Edinburgh Fringe regularly - we are a community of experienced and devoted artists). However, we are new to many crucial aspects of this industry - the nitty-gritty of producing, marketing the play, acquiring funding - we really are learning as we go along. Every mistake we have made has provided us with a lesson in ensuring excellence and avoiding absolute chaos (hahaha, absolute chaos, mate!). The main challenge we face, with two weeks until we go up, is selling out our venue through ardent promotion, and also hitting this £1500 landmark in such a short space of time. I'll be honest - I haven't given ourselves much time. But as someone who thrives off impulse, and is hellbent on bringing artistic visions to life, we brought this play together in the moment, because we simply couldn't wait to bring you and so many more people together on such a beautiful, momentous occasion.We are all acquainted with industry professionals who can pull us out of any mud we find ourselves stuck in. While we are very much in the position to negotiate fees or make last minute adjustments, we have an ideal version of the show is in our hands, and with some extra funding, we can grip onto our intentions and execute our show how it is meant to be executed. If we do not hit our target we'll recover our losses through working, correspond with our associates to evaluate our strategies, and go back to the drawing board for our next production - but who knows what opportunities may vanish before us if we have no choice but to compromise? We don't want such a situation to arise - please, help us ensure that the play becomes a true success, for the benefit of us all. This is a not-for-profit project - I don't want a single penny to myself. All I want is for Pat On The Back Productions and Redgates Theatre to continue making great art for the greater good - your contribution will assure that this simple wish is granted. This art is for all of us, and this page is a way of bringing us together to heal our world through storytelling, one step and one day at a time. No more divides between artists and audiences - let's all come together to create truly astounding work, made by all of us, for all of us. Other Ways You Can HelpI'm a firm believer that nothing is impossible - its just that some things are very, very, very difficult. However, we genuinely believe that if we try our utmost, we may hit or perhaps even exceed our target before August the 1st. If you have read this far, you are an absolute legend, and please contact me personally to gain a discount code for our show! (on Twitter or Facebook) - a cheeky little reward for your intrigue! It's the least I could do for you taking interest in our journey. But if you cannot make the days for whatever reason, your contribution, or even by sharing the post onto your social media circles, talking about the play with your nearest and dearest, or using the indiegogo share tools to get the word out, will bring us one step closer to a new horizon of an ideal humanity. Theatre is the 'sacred arena of the imagination', as Simon Callow once said; and our show is a dream-like poem, it is our imagination unchained; it is our most beautiful ideas on stage. Art to me is proof that we are alive, so let's make our dreams come true for once! What else are dreams for other than to realise what's possible?This play is a passion project, it is a brave adaptation, it is my highs and lows; this play means everything to me, and we can all be in this together. Join us as we venture into the great unknown; things will never be the same when we reach that brighter future. As Anthony Bayele would chant in our house frequently: 'Let's Get It!'This is only the beginning. Take care, my friends. Yours truly,Patrick Bayele.Thank you - from the Bayeles. I wish I was smiling properly in this photo! Ahh well :).

story:
MIGRATIONS: a new dance experience in wonderfully weird Austin Texas!

Migrations aims to bring various forms of dance and music fusion together for your enjoyment in three days of workshops and performances.

WHO WE ARE:

Founded by Austin Tribal Collective, a group of dancers who have spent many years investing time and love into the local dance community, Migrations represents our combined appreciation for many forms of dance, music, and new explorations across boundaries.

This event will bring new opportunities to dancers both near and far - those who call Austin home and those who love to visit - and highlight the many wonderful local resources and supporters of dance and music in Austin.

Dancers, musicians, and art lovers like YOU can play a crucial role in helping us create Migrations! We have our hearts set on making this festival a long-standing event, and now is the best time to lend us your support. Plus, you get some awesome stuff!

We have a small but varied  selection of local and visiting instructors ready to bring you ethnically diverse dance and music workshops, both for beginning students and more experienced performers. With an emphasis on world dance and Tribal stylizations of belly dance, this event will  be an exciting and complimentary opportunity to the existing festivities in our town.

WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

The majority of the funds raised  will go  to securing a diverse and unique lineup of instructors, funding the venue (TBD; we are pursuing many leads to find the most beautiful, quirky, suitable space possible!), and back into the community for future local educational opportunities. There are many facets of this event that will need funding; our primary goals are securing our teachers and a unique and spacious place for them and all of you to call home for a few days!

WHAT YOU GET FOR DONATING:

We have tons of fun and unique prizes for your involvement in this massive project. Please take a look at all of the pledge incentives listed here. They include:

  • A virtual dance class with April Rose, local Bellydance Superstar!
  • A fabulous custom costume created by local designer Liora Murrah!
  • A private brunch for you and some of our instructors during the event!
  • A chance at free admission to the entire event, lodging and travel included!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Spread the word!! We aim to reach artists near and far. 

  • LIKE us on Facebook!
  • Follow us on Twitter!
  • Check out our website and sign up for the mailing list!
  • Are you an INSTRUCTOR or EVENT PLANNER? Let us know if you'd like to partner with us in promoting Migrations in your classes or at events! Email migrationsaustin@gmail.com. 

Not a dancer or musician, but still want to help out? We are looking for small local Austin businesses to partner with as sponsors; if you're interested or you just want to make a general donation, please email us at migrationsaustin@gmail.com!

GRATITUDE

Thank you so much for your help with this huge endeavor; we very much hope to meet you at Migrations in 2017!

FunToMime Surabaya

~Lé Carnaval~

Derive from a passion to revive Indonesia Pantomime Arts, Septian Dwi Cahyo, Indonesia Pantomime Maestro, Since 2012 came with the idea of "FunToMime", to send messages to the society. Mime is Fun. Pantomime isn't that hard. It can be done by anyone, anywhere, anytime. We prove them in a stage play. Practices are more effective than theories, they say.

Under Septian Dwi Cahyo and Louis Lie MasterMime’s supervision, Surabaya Pantomime Community is cooperating with HOME Theater, Jonie SQL (API Comedian from Surabaya), Broomstick Theater (Student Activity Unit of Petra Christian University), and Art College Students from Surabaya State University (UNESA) presents FunToMime Surabaya in a storyline entitled "Lé Carnaval". Hand in hand, to bring Indonesia Pantomime towards a higher level.

StoryLine

Happiness, is a dream which every child looks for. In their innocence, they search the light of happiness during their lives journey. Parent's fights and feeling isolated by the society often turn children becoming loners and loss sense of happiness. What is happiness?

Risus Box is opened. A colorful world which is nothing like real world. Fantasy becomes reality. The journey through fantasy world begins. One by one, the fantasy souls show up to represent Power, Humor, Love, Invention, Imagination, and Hope. Happiness of a child is created. After Risus box is closed, will the happiness be gone disappear? Find it only at FunToMime Surabaya "Lé Carnaval”.


BUJANG GANONG, East Java Culture Character.
credit: snowkie

Event Concept

Based on the vision and missions of FunToMime Surabaya, we create a showing performance concept, which will be realized as :

1. “FunToMime Surabaya: Lé Carnaval” Night Performance

  • Time : 19.00-21.00
  • Open Gate : 18.00
  • Location : Ballroom 89, Ciputra World, Jalan Mayjend Sungkono 89, Surabaya, Indonesia

Admission Prices :

  • Platinum Tickets   IDR 150,000 | about USD$ 12.5 (For 100 people)
  • Gold Tickets           IDR 130,000 | about USD$ 10.8 (For 200 people)
  • Silver Tickets         IDR 85,000 | about USD$ 7.0 (For 350 people)

Book NOW! and get Special Workshop Package Offer, contact our FunToMime Surabaya Online RSVP NOW:
Larasati Sistha (+62 898 3896 771)

  • Schedule Day : Friday, 24 April 2015

  • Open re-Registration : 17.00

  • A special privilege for Video Contest Winner and event Contributors/Backers (YES! You!), a Special Lunch Time with Septian Dwi Cahyo on Sunday, 26 April 2015.

5. “FunToMime Surabaya: Lé Carnaval” Roadshow

  • Date : 20 – 22 April 2015 (and around)
  • Watch skits performance of FunToMime Surabaya Characters and Mimers during certain events and street performance at vendor locations around Surabaya (school, mall, etc.)
  • Special Early Bird Price of Workshop Registration and Night Performance Ticket are available to be purchased during our Roadshow / Pre-Order

6. “FunToMime Surabaya: Lé Carnaval” Bazaar

  • Time : 10.00 - 22.00
  • Location : V-Walk, Ciputra World, Jalan Mayjend Sungkono 89, Surabaya, Indonesia
  • Discover Communities products and FunToMime Surabaya Partners’ product line only at our Bazaar
  • Don’t miss it, unique pre-performance by FunToMime Surabaya Characters! And of course, a TRICK EYE SELFIE CONTEST!

If you are interested, you may contact us for Early Booth Reservation and get our Special Price Offer:

  • In most cases, international shipping takes around 20-30 business days.
  • We ship to confirmed PAYPAL addresses. Your PAYPAL address MUST MATCH your Shipping address.

Informasi Lebih Lanjut dan Pemesanan Online:
Larasati Sistha (+62 898 3896 771)
funtomimesurabaya@gmail.com


FunToMime Surabaya

~Lé Carnaval~

Berawal dari semangat untuk membangkitan seni Pantomim Indonesia, sejak 2012 Septian Dwi Cahyo, Maestro Pantomim Indonesia, menciptakan ide tentang "FunToMime", untuk memberi pesan kepada masyarakat, bahwa memainkan Pantomim sangat menyenangkan. Pantomim tidaklah begitu sulit. Pantomim dapat dimainkan oleh siapa saja, dimana saja, dan kapan saja. Kami dapat membuktikan semua itu di dalam sebuah pertunjukan. Praktek lebih ampuh daripada teori, kata mereka.

Komunitas Pantomime Surabaya dalam arahan Septian Dwi Cahyo dan Louis Lie MasterMime bekerja sama dengan HOME Theater,Jonie SQL (Komedian API asal Surabaya), Teater Broomstick (salah satu Unit Kegiatan Mahasiswa di bawah naungan Universitas Kristen Petra), serta mahasiswa Universitas Negeri Surabaya Jurusan Seni, Drama, Tari, dan Musik mempersembahkan FunToMime Surabaya dalam tajuk "Lé Carnaval". Bersatu padu membawa Pantomim Indonesia menuju tingkat lebih tinggi.

Alur Cerita

Kebahagiaan, dambaan setiap Anak-anak. Dalam kepolosannya, Anak-anak mencari cahaya bahagia di perjalanan hidupnya. Ayah dan ibu yang sedang bertengkar, perasaan terkucil dari lingkungan, seringkali membuat Anak-anak menjadi penyendiri dan hilangnya rasa bahagia. Bahagia, apakah itu?

Sebuah Kotak Risus terbuka. Menghadirkan dunia penuh warna yang sangat berbeda dari kenyataan. Fantasi menjadi kenyataan. Perjalanan dunia fantasi dimulai. Silih berganti Makhluk Fantasi bermunculan dalam mewakili Kekuatan, Jenaka, Cinta Kasih, Kreasi, Imajinasi, dan Harapan. Kebahagiaan seorang Anak tercipta. Setelah kotak Risus tertutup, apakah kebahagiaan tersebut akan hilang? Temukan jawabannya hanya di FunToMime Surabaya "Lé Carnaval”.

Konsep Acara

Berdasarkan visi dan misi kegiatan, maka terciptalah konsep Acara Pementasan yang akan kami realisasikan berupa :

1. Malam Pertunjukan “FunToMime Surabaya: Lé Carnaval”

  • Tanggal : Sabtu, 25 April 2015
  • Waktu : 19.00 – 21.00
  • Open Gate : 18.00
  • Lokasi : Ballroom 89, Ciputra World, Jalan Mayjend Sungkono 89, Surabaya, Indonesia

Harga Tiket Masuk :

  • Tiket Platinum     Rp 150.000,- (Untuk 100 orang)
  • Tiket Gold               Rp 130.000,- (Untuk 200 orang)
  • Tiket Silver             Rp 85.000,- (Untuk 350 orang)

Pesan SEKARANG juga! Dan dapatkan harga Spesial Paket Workshop dengan menghubungi Sekretariat FunToMime Surabaya SEKARANG JUGA:
Larasati Sistha (+62 898 3896 771)

2. Workshop and Talkshow with Septian Dwi Cahyo

  • Jadwal Workshop : Jum’at, 24 April 2015
  • Waktu : 18.00 - 20.00
  • Open re-Registration : 17.00
  • Lokasi : Midtown Hotel, Jalan Basuki Rahmat no. 76, Surabaya, Indonesia
  • Target Peserta : Terbuka untuk Umum.

FunToMime Surabaya
~Lé Carnaval~
Derive from a passion to revive Indonesia Pantomime Arts, Septian Dwi Cahyo, Indonesia Pantomime Maestro, Since 2012 came with the idea of "FunToMime", to send messages to the society. Mime is Fun. Pantomime isn't that hard. It can be done by anyone, anywhere, anytime. We prove them in a stage play. Practices are more effective than theories, they say.
Under Septian Dwi Cahyo and Louis Lie MasterMime’s supervision, Surabaya Pantomime Community is cooperating with HOME Theater, Jonie SQL (API Comedian from Surabaya), Broomstick Theater (Student Activity Unit of Petra Christian University), and Art College Students from Surabaya State University (UNESA) presents FunToMime Surabaya in a storyline entitled "Lé Carnaval". Hand in hand, to bring Indonesia Pantomime towards a higher level.

StoryLine
Happiness, is a dream which every child looks for. In their innocence, they search the light of happiness during their lives journey. Parent's fights and feeling isolated by the society often turn children becoming loners and loss sense of happiness. What is happiness?
Risus Box is opened. A colorful world which is nothing like real world. Fantasy becomes reality. The journey through fantasy world begins. One by one, the fantasy souls show up to represent Power, Humor, Love, Invention, Imagination, and Hope. Happiness of a child is created. After Risus box is closed, will the happiness be gone disappear? Find it only at FunToMime Surabaya "Lé Carnaval”.

BUJANG GANONG, East Java Culture Character.  
credit: snowkie

FunToMime Surabaya
~Lé Carnaval~
Berawal dari semangat untuk membangkitan seni Pantomim Indonesia, sejak 2012 Septian Dwi Cahyo, Maestro Pantomim Indonesia, menciptakan ide tentang "FunToMime", untuk memberi pesan kepada masyarakat, bahwa memainkan Pantomim sangat menyenangkan. Pantomim tidaklah begitu sulit. Pantomim dapat dimainkan oleh siapa saja, dimana saja, dan kapan saja. Kami dapat membuktikan semua itu di dalam sebuah pertunjukan. Praktek lebih ampuh daripada teori, kata mereka.
Komunitas Pantomime Surabaya dalam arahan Septian Dwi Cahyo dan Louis Lie MasterMime bekerja sama dengan HOME Theater,Jonie SQL (Komedian API asal Surabaya), Teater Broomstick (salah satu Unit Kegiatan Mahasiswa di bawah naungan Universitas Kristen Petra), serta mahasiswa Universitas Negeri Surabaya Jurusan Seni, Drama, Tari, dan Musik mempersembahkan FunToMime Surabaya dalam tajuk "Lé Carnaval". Bersatu padu membawa Pantomim Indonesia menuju tingkat lebih tinggi.

Alur Cerita
Kebahagiaan, dambaan setiap Anak-anak. Dalam kepolosannya, Anak-anak mencari cahaya bahagia di perjalanan hidupnya. Ayah dan ibu yang sedang bertengkar, perasaan terkucil dari lingkungan, seringkali membuat Anak-anak menjadi penyendiri dan hilangnya rasa bahagia. Bahagia, apakah itu?
Sebuah Kotak Risus terbuka. Menghadirkan dunia penuh warna yang sangat berbeda dari kenyataan. Fantasi menjadi kenyataan. Perjalanan dunia fantasi dimulai. Silih berganti Makhluk Fantasi bermunculan dalam mewakili Kekuatan, Jenaka, Cinta Kasih, Kreasi, Imajinasi, dan Harapan. Kebahagiaan seorang Anak tercipta. Setelah kotak Risus tertutup, apakah kebahagiaan tersebut akan hilang? Temukan jawabannya hanya di FunToMime Surabaya "Lé Carnaval”.

story:
Jura Soyfer: Der Lechner Edi schaut ins Paradies
Ein Projekt des Verein Showmotions


Ja, stop auf der Fahrt zur Vergangenheit,
Sonst wird noch das Steuer zerkrachen!
Denn in der Einbahnstraße der Zeit,
Da läßt sich nichts ungeschehen machen!
Wir lassen getan sein, was einmal getan,
Und nehmen, was wir erhalten.
Wir haben ein Erbe, auf uns kommt es an,
Daß wir es gehörig verwalten!
Jura Soyfer


„Der Lechner Edi schaut ins Paradies“ ist Jura Soyfers zweites Theaterstück und wurde im Oktober 1936 in Wien uraufgeführt. 1936 war bekanntlich eine Zeit in denen es den Menschen in Österreich sehr schlecht ging. Die Arbeitslosigkeit war auf einem Höhepunkt und die Industrialisierung in den Fabriken wurde mit Argwohn beobachtet. Die Angst von Maschinen ersetzt zu werden war sehr groß und natürlich teilweise auch nicht unbegründet.


Jura Soyfer nähert sich diesem Thema auf besondere Weise:
Nachdem Edi Lechner in der Schuhfabrik gekündigt wird, ist er außer sich. Die Maschine wird immer weiter entwickelt und die Menschen werden abgebaut. Gemeinsam mit seiner Freundin Fritzi steht er nun vor der Frage, wie es mit ihm weiter gehen soll, in dieser schrecklichen Zeit. Kurz darauf taucht aber auch die Maschine „Pepi“ auf, die aufgrund einer neuen Maschine abgebaut wurde und nun auch ohne Arbeit ist. Jetzt stellt sich die Frage, wer ist schuld an der Misere? Die ist aber schnell beantwortet:


MOTOR: I waß scho, wer schuld is an dem ganzen Jammer
EDI kampflustig: Da bin i aber gspannt.
MOTOR: Ein Italiener.
EDI: Ah?
MOTOR: Jawohl. Der Galvani.
FRITZI: Haßt der net anders?
EDI: Pscht! Wieso is der schuld?
MOTOR: Er hat die Kontaktelektrizität erfunden.
EDI: Die Elektrizität - natürlich! Also Galvani heißt der Falott?


So bleibt ihnen nichts anderes übrig als die Reise durch die Zeit zu wagen und Galvanis Erfindung zu verhindern. Als das auch nichts nutzt, geht es weiter. Zu Galileo Galilei, Kolumbus, Gutenberg und schließlich bis zurück zur Erfindung des Menschen.
Am Ende bleibt bei Soyfer folgende Botschaft: Auf uns kommt’s an!

Das haben wir uns zu Herzen genommen:

Nach dem großen Erfolg des Projektes und den zahlreichen Interessenten, die keine Karten mehr bekommen haben, möchten wir das Projekt fortsetzen und weiter tragen. Die öffentlichen Mittel der Stadtgemeinde sind uns aber gestrichen worden. Wir geben aber nicht auf und versuchen das Projekt auch so zu finanzieren.

Mit Ihrem Beitrag schaffen Sie sich Ihre Kultur selbst.

story:
OTHELLO

Once upon a time, a hot white man named William Shakespeare sat down and wrote a play about a hot black man, thus kicking off a long history of writers overstepping the boundaries of their lived experience. 

This beautiful tradition has given us many classic works of film, theatre, music and literature. From Elvis to Cher, Picasso to Disney, from the East Coast of Turtle Island to the... West Coast of Turtle Island, our collective history would be nothing without the bold audacity of someone in a position of power appropriating the story of a marginalized person.  

With all the knowledge we have gained since Othello was originally penned and performed, how might a 21st century perspective supported by the critical approaches of feminism and post-colonialism alter what we have come to know and understand from one of Shakespeare's most complicated and controversial works? 

In January 2020, Winnipeg is gonna find out!

WHO WE ARE

Hi. My name is Frances Koncan and I am writing this short summary on behalf of Vault Projects Productions and Beau Theatre Co., at the behest of Indiegogo, who promise that if I introduce myself that this campaign will undoubtedly succeed!

I'm a writer, director, and producer working in theatre and television. Most recently, I was a writer for the TV series That's AWSM! on APTN and my next play, Women of the Fur Trade, will be premiering at the Royal Manitoba Theatre Centre in February 2020. This year, I also embarked on a surprising new career as a journalist at the Winnipeg Free Press. It's fun, but I get a lot of hate mail. 

This year, Vault Projects is teaming up with Beau Theatre Co. to bring Othello to life at the Master Playwrights Festival with a diverse cast and creative team comprised of some of Winnipeg's most talented artists, including: 

  • Ray Strachan as Othello
  • Kevin Klassen as Iago
  • Olivia Raine as Desdemona 
  • Haley Vincent as Emilia
  • Jude Hayes as Cassio
  • Marie Kozyra as As Many Ensemble Roles As Possible Because We're On a Budget

 

With: 

  • Costume Design by Erin Meagan Schwartz
  • Sound Design by Sami Desiree
  • Lighting and Set Design by Frances Koncan (remember, we're on a BUDGET!)
  • Stage Management by Leah Borchert
  • Apprentice Director Sophie Smith-Dostmohammad
  • Assistant Director Jonathan Mourant
  • Directed and adapted by Frances Koncan

 

WHAT WE NEED

Through corporate sponsors, grants, and fundraising efforts, we are hoping to raise a total of $16,000 to cover the up front production costs of mounting Othello. 

  • $12,000 Artist Honorariums
  • $1500 Rehearsal Studio and Venue Rental
  • $2000 Materials, Construction and Admin Costs
  • $500 for ASL Interpretation and accessibility initiatives 

 

Our production employs both equity and non-equity artists of varying experience levels to foster the opportunities to share and learn from one another. We value the energy, ideas and expertise of our artists and prioritize them in our funding and creation methods.

Your contribution to our campaign goal of $5000 will give us a big push towards being able to offer them an honorarium they deserve!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Money is tight and times are hard — we feel that. If you're not able to make a contribution, there are still ways to spread the word and help support us in bringing Othello to the stage!

  • Share this campaign with your friends, enemies, family and sugar parents! 
  • Do you have studio space? Props or costumes we could borrow? Extra wood? Are you good with a saw? (I'm not!) Do you like hanging posters? (I don't!) We can always use volunteers to help out in a variety of ways. If you'd like to volunteer, give us a shout and we'll hook you up with free tickets in exchange for your support!

Hi. My name is Frances Koncan and I am writing this short summary on behalf of Vault Projects Productions and Beau Theatre Co., at the behest of Indiegogo, who promise that if I introduce myself that this campaign will undoubtedly succeed!
I'm a writer, director, and producer working in theatre and television. Most recently, I was a writer for the TV series That's AWSM! on APTN and my next play, Women of the Fur Trade, will be premiering at the Royal Manitoba Theatre Centre in February 2020. This year, I also embarked on a surprising new career as a journalist at the Winnipeg Free Press. It's fun, but I get a lot of hate mail. 
This year, Vault Projects is teaming up with Beau Theatre Co. to bring Othello to life at the Master Playwrights Festival with a diverse cast and creative team comprised of some of Winnipeg's most talented artists, including: 


Ray Strachan as Othello


Kevin Klassen as Iago


Olivia Raine as Desdemona 


Haley Vincent as Emilia


Jude Hayes as Cassio


Marie Kozyra as As Many Ensemble Roles As Possible Because We're On a Budget


 
With: 


Costume Design by Erin Meagan Schwartz


Sound Design by Sami Desiree


Lighting and Set Design by Frances Koncan (remember, we're on a BUDGET!)

Stage Management by Leah Borchert


Apprentice Director Sophie Smith-Dostmohammad


Assistant Director Jonathan Mourant


Directed and adapted by Frances Koncan



 
WHAT WE NEED
Through corporate sponsors, grants, and fundraising efforts, we are hoping to raise a total of $16,000 to cover the up front production costs of mounting Othello. 

$12,000 Artist Honorariums
$1500 Rehearsal Studio and Venue Rental
$2000 Materials, Construction and Admin Costs
$500 for ASL Interpretation and accessibility initiatives 

 
Our production employs both equity and non-equity artists of varying experience levels to foster the opportunities to share and learn from one another. We value the energy, ideas and expertise of our artists and prioritize them in our funding and creation methods.
Your contribution to our campaign goal of $5000 will give us a big push towards being able to offer them an honorarium they deserve!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP
Money is tight and times are hard — we feel that. If you're not able to make a contribution, there are still ways to spread the word and help support us in bringing Othello to the stage!

Share this campaign with your friends, enemies, family and sugar parents! 
Do you have studio space? Props or costumes we could borrow? Extra wood? Are you good with a saw? (I'm not!) Do you like hanging posters? (I don't!) We can always use volunteers to help out in a variety of ways. If you'd like to volunteer, give us a shout and we'll hook you up with free tickets in exchange for your support!

story:
We are a team of experienced and young artistis in theatre that we decided to perform for he first time in the island of Cyprus, the translated in greek, theatrical masterpiece of Roger Vitrac, VICTOR or THE CHILDREN IN POWER. The team/ensamble includes 10 actors and 4 more artists for the directing, the set, the lights, the organizing of the production

 

With the money that will be raised, the expences for this unique production will be paid -meaning the director, the set-and costumes designer, the lighting designer, the studio for the music, the cost of the carpenter and the people that will build the set, the lay –out artist and the typing of the posters, program and rest of the paper material etc, etc

MINAS TIGKILIS

Director, Theatrologist

Biographical Note

Minas Tigkilis graduated from the drama school of the National Theatre of Greece (1980) and the School of Political Science and Public Administration of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, and holds a postgraduate degree in Theatre Studies from the same university.

He published and edited the theatre review «Εκκύκλημα/Ekkyklema» (1983-1991), was director of the Piraeus Municipal Cultural Development Company (1992-1996) and a contributor (theatre critic) to the weekly journal ΕΝΑ.

He has been living and working in Cyprus since 1999. He was Artistic Director of the Limassol Theatre Development Company from 1999 to 2016, where he directed over thirty plays from the world repertoire, and organised cultural events, symposia, and conferences.

During the period 2011-2014 he was a member of CCOITI, from 2014 to 2017 he was Vice President of the Board of Directors, and since 2017, he has been President of the Board of Directors.

Since 2011, he has represented Cyprus at the ITI International Monodrama Forum, and in 2017, at the 35th ITI World Congress, he was elected Vice President of the Forum.

As Artistic Director he has organised the Monodrama Showcase/2015, the 1st Monodrama Platform of Cypriot Artists/2016 and the 1st International Monodrama Festival 2017, as part of the Programme of the Cultural Capital of Europe “Paphos 2017”.

In the last two years, he has been working as director and/or actor with Theatro ENA, Theatro Versus and the Paphos Actors’ Cooperative Touring Company.

story:
DUMAS THEATRE COMPANY presents: CONSTELLATIONS

Dumas Theatre Company, founded in Issaquah, WA would like to invite you along our journey as we work to bring exciting, contemporary theatre to the Greater Seattle area. 

Our inaugural production is CONSTELLATIONS by Nick Payne, a mind bending drama focusing on the relationship of Roland, a beekeeper and Marianne, a "theoretical cosmologist." Taking place in several simultaneous universes, we see the couple through hope and despair and question if it would be better to live every possible choice or live with our decisions: for better or worse. 

By supporting us, we will have the resources to continue creating professional, high-quality art. We strive make accessible, thought-provoking art but like any group of artists, we might need a little help along the way. 

We hope to see you at our shows! Be sure to check us out at: 

facebook.com/dumastheatreco

story:
About Terianne 

My name is Terianne Falcone and I am a long-time actress and comedienne. I love performing ‘Good Grief: Stories at 207 West 88th Street’ because of the compassion it evokes in audiences, and I believe compassion can go a long way in our society today. 

I have been involved in many aspects of acting since the 90’s—television, film, radio and more New York off-Broadway shows than I can count. Being Will Ferrell's over-the-top Italian girlfriend on Saturday Night Live was a highlight, but my greatest joy came when I started creating my own work with the financial support of Artistic New Directions theatre company in New York where the late great Gary Austin of Groundlings fame became my mentor and director. 

More recently I lived in Rome while performing and teaching acting and improvisation. I now live in Brighton, England, and what better way to introduce Bruna (the character in the video above!)  to the UK than at the incredible Brighton Fringe Festival. The work has gotten some nice reviews: latest from GScene, a local LGBT magazine, wrote: "She holds the stage magnetically and magnificently, and her true skill is in bringing out their humanity and making the point that grief can be good." 

Real people, real stories

I am passionate about this show because the stories I tell are from real people from my time living on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. I felt compelled to write them down. There’s bespectacled "Mona" who came to see a room I had for rent, an elderly cab driver with a shocking story about World War II, Emily from a girls’ sleepover and a shocking tale from a New York Times headline. 

Then there’s Bruna, the main character, the heart of the show. She's the outlandish, but wise, outrageous, but lovable elderly Italian superintendent of the building at 207 West 88th Street. "I'ma de soup of de build!" she says. Audiences fall in love with her. She is based on a real life Bruna who actually had a husband named Bruno. She was rough on the edges but ultimately kind. She stirs up a lot of feeling in audiences. 

Everyone has a story, a story that moves us, shocks us, or even makes our heart skip a beat.  We probably hear similar stories everyday but we really listen when we put them onstage. 

 

The Band

Onstage with me is Purple Pudding Clause, aka the Lovell family: Steve on guitar, Rachel on cello and David on percussion. 

Rachel Lovell was previously a guitarist and singer in seminal seventies indie band Dolly Mixture and she appeared as backing vocalist for Captain Sensible’s number one hit Happy Talk.

Steve Lovell was a record producer and guitarist for over twenty years, producing amongst many others, Blur, James, Julian Copes first two solo albums and Holly Johnson’s hit singles. He also played guitar and did musical arrangements for many of the artists he produced. 

David Lovell is their 16 year old son.He has been playing drums and guitar since he was 2 years old. He is also a very talented visual artist and at the age of 12 completed his first book cover commission.

You can find them at www.thepurplepuddingclause.wordpress.com. Their first album entitled 'First' was released in 2015 and their second 'Far Flung Futures' will be released in the
autumn.

 

Our Techie Guys!

James Prideaux is new to theatre tech and he just jumped in!

 

Andy Moseley showed him the ropes.

Knowing they had my back enabled me to relax as I knew All Things Tech were, or would be, sorted! Whew! Thanks guys!

 

What the show needs and what you get

There are many expenses involved such as registration fees, promotional expenses, marketing, props, hiring items and services. 

By contributing you will not just be helping the show but the communities around it. Theatre is powerful; it's healing. I've had members of the public come up to me in tears, thanking me because one of the stories reflected their own life.

And the silly, fun perks -- something to make you feel "Spesh" as Bruna would say! From a specialized video greeting from Bruna to a live meeting with her; to a personalized song to your own show! Take a look on the right and see what makes you smile most!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to contribute financially there are other ways you can help:

•   Use the Indiegogo share tools so that other people can see the campaign. 

•   Follow me on social media and take a second to share/retweet/repost my show-related posts.

•   Come see the show in Brighton Fringe! Saturday 3rd/ Sunday 4th June at 2pm at the Theatre Box at The Warren pop-up venue at St. Peters Church in the heart of Brighton.

story:
Why "Cash In Your Blessings"? 

As children, we’re all told to dream big and strive for greatness and to fulfill our dreams…this is my dream. I’ve had a joy of writing since forever. From I was a little girl, reading and writing has been my favorite pastime. If I wasn't busy climbing mango trees, playing hopscotch or racing with my cousins and friends, I was reading a book or writing one in my notebook. I published my first children's book when I was ten years old, and by published, I mean I wrote a story about animals and I used the box from my Animal Crackers snack as the book cover. Let’s just say that was one of my most memorable summers ever. I really wished someone had kept my one and only copy. So, writing has been a lifelong interest of mine. Having wrote this stage play and to see it in production would be making a dream come true for me. However, I need your help to make it happen.

 

Why Now?

Now, because I want to stop procrastinating and doubting myself that this can really happen. That this gal from the islands can achieve such goals. A quote I like from the late Dr. Myles Monroe is, “the greatest tragedy in life is not death, but a life without purpose.” Writing this play is part of my purpose. Not only will producing this stage play fulfill one of my dreams – but also those of the actors and other members on the production team.

 

Where will the money go?

I’ve quickly discovered writing my first stage play may have been the easiest part. There’s so much that goes into producing a stage play, things that I wasn’t aware of. Which is why I’m needing help to produce a professional stage play. Money raised will go towards covering production expenses, such as: venue fees, design costs, marketing costs, consultation, insurance, paying actors, and other production crew, etc. My hope is to have the first show in the Fall of 2018 at a local theater in Maryland or Washington, DC. Any donation amount would be greatly appreciated, and I will forever be grateful to you for your assistance.

YOU CAN CHOOSE ONE OF THE PERKS TO THE LEFT WITH YOUR DONATION OR YOU CAN DONATE WITHOUT ACCEPTING A PERK. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!

 

About Khara:

Khara Campbell is the author of seven novels and a children’s book. She holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Creative Writing from Midland Lutheran University. She enjoys blogging about the happenings of life, faith, parenting, her publishing journey, marriage, fashion, and her Bahamian heritage on www.kharacampbell.blogspot.com. She was born and raised in Nassau, The Bahamas. She resides in the Washington, DC metro area with her husband and their three children. Khara is a contributor to http://theprayingwoman.com/. She wrote an essay for Ebony Magazine and she was also featured in Bronze Magazine and the Tribune Newspaper in Nassau, The Bahamas.

story:
It's Alive!!! (about our Creation)

 

  • We are a group of various actors, writers, artists, theatre enthusiast. indie film makers, costumers & musicians in the New Orleans area.

 

  • Upon moving to this Darkly Romantic area to finally discover and delve into the Creole Roots my family had always talked about, I (Lazlo Aluisa) had expected to find (amongst the ever so present & thriving art/entertainment scene) some kind of Late Night Horror Theatre. Local writer Ann Rice had so vividly depicted her "Theatre of the Vampires" in her now classic novel "Interview With the Vampire," that it just seemed natural that there would be something like this. However, to my disappointment, no such or similar outlet existed. Over the years, time and time again, I have heard so many original and vital artists & musicians say that what inspired them was just as much what they were "not" seeing/hearing and so they decided to become  advocates for what they longed for. This resonated  deeply with me. So I took their cue and decide to create such an outlet. Having a love for other genres other than just vampires this is what I came up with as my own contribution. 

 

  • To say that "I" came up with this is a huge understatement. At best this is quite simply a continuation to a long tradition of great and terrible stories going as far back as cave paintings, and that has inspired everything from the earliest campfire stories, mythology, religion, as well as classic and modern works of literature, theatre & film. We (the troupe) only hope that our contributions to these mediums can add something of value. The "I" in that statement is, of course, also overshadowed by my collogues... one of the most fantastic groups of creative individuals that I have ever known . Such individuals are so awe inspiring to me. I am so fortunate & blessed to be working with them and hope that you know, my fellow theatre enthusiast, that it would mean so much to me if you would not only support my efforts but theirs as well.

What We ReallyNeed Help With & What You Get...

  • The beauty of what we are trying to achieve is that SO MUCH OF IT IS ALREADY PAID FOR. A local venue that we are proud to call home (on the Heart of Bourbon Street) is so inspired by what we are putting together that they have vowed to give us the whole third floor of their Creole Townhouse Venue RENT FREE as long as we are producing such entertainment and as long as we contribute the sound system, lights, talent, content, and patrons. They  know that there is nothing else like this that is currently being produced in the region. They feel so confident that this is going to contribute so much to their venue that they are even building the stage for it. However, even though we have their vote of confidence and are so close to fulfilling our end of things, there are some fundamental things that we still need to obtain to get up and running on our end and to add a certain level of quality to it all.

 

  • We are asking anyone/everyone who is so inspired to donate a minimum of $20 or even more if you can. Smaller donations are, of course, welcome and most appreciated as well for those of you who are in a pinch yet would still like to contribute.

 

  • Locals (in the New Orleans Area): You will get a set of free tableside seating passes to a show and will be told where they can obtain free general admission passes anytime that you would like to attend a show. You will get links to videos of full captured shows once we shoot them, edit them, and upload them to the web. You will also get a membership to the "Rock Monster Social Club," which is a social club that will keep you informed on cool double feature film screenings, other underground music, art, and theatre events, as well as a card that you can use to eat and drink for major discounts in select local venues (sometimes as much as 50% off).

 

  • Non-Locals: You will get links to videos of full captured shows once we shoot them, edit them, and upload them to the web. You will also get everything promised to locals if/whenever you visit the area. You will be invited to join the Facebook group of the "Rock Monster Social Club" that will keep you informed on what is going on with the project. If/when you come to town you will also get a temporary membership card that will keep you informed on cool double feature film screenings, other underground music, art, and theatre events to check out while you are here in town and that you can use to eat and drink for major discounts in select local venues while you are here in town.

 

  • The funds raised will mostly go to technical aspects, sets, costuming, and makeup (the performers will make their pay off of tickets sold and "pass the hat" donations). We have sound and lights taken care of but need to get a laptop and a few tablet computers to control the software that controls the sound and lights. We aim to also obtain a "backline" of musical amps and equipment so that not only will the house band not have to load gear in & out every night but so we can also put on some cool underground music shows on nights where we do not do the theatre. We also have some reusable sets pieces to build, some costumes to make/obtain, and some theatrical and special fx make up to purchase. Any extra or leftover funds will be used to continue to make set pieces, costumes, and obtain makeup.

Risks & Challenges

  • Not many risks because, as previously pointed out, we have a venue that is willing to give the room RENT FREE as long as we are producing. We have a great marketing plan that includes many associate partners that are ready to get on board and help us network it.

 

  • However, as mentioned, we are still behind on some of the things mentioned above and have a mid-October date that is pressing towards us. So we not only want to nail down all of our production needs but we want to impress upon the venue that we know what we are doing, can handle this, and that their vote of confidence in us is not in vain. So, once again, this is why we are appealing to you, our fellow art & theatre enthusiasts.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and help spread the word about us on various social medias that you use ! Please send links to our campaign to anyone and everyone that you feel might be interested in this kind of art/entertainment and what we are doing.

 

  • Join our "Rock Monsters Social Club: Facebook group. Send us a request so that we can keep you up to date on where we are at and what we are doing.

 

  • Don't Forget to Rock and to Be Yourself! So little time and so little quality of life that is afforded us in these modern hectic times. You owe it to yourself to breathe, enjoy your friends, loved ones, family, your surroundings and to keep rocking on! Thank you for taking the time to check us out!
  •

The beauty of what we are trying to achieve is that SO MUCH OF IT IS ALREADY PAID FOR. A local venue that we are proud to call home (on the Heart of Bourbon Street) is so inspired by what we are putting together that they have vowed to give us the whole third floor of their Creole Townhouse Venue RENT FREE as long as we are producing such entertainment and as long as we contribute the sound system, lights, talent, content, and patrons. They  know that there is nothing else like this that is currently being produced in the region. They feel so confident that this is going to contribute so much to their venue that they are even building the stage for it. However, even though we have their vote of confidence and are so close to fulfilling our end of things, there are some fundamental things that we still need to obtain to get up and running on our end and to add a certain level of quality to it all.
 
We are asking anyone/everyone who is so inspired to donate a minimum of $20 or even more if you can. Smaller donations are, of course, welcome and most appreciated as well for those of you who are in a pinch yet would still like to contribute.
 

Locals (in the New Orleans Area): You will get a set of free tableside seating passes to a show and will be told where they can obtain free general admission passes anytime that you would like to attend a show. You will get links to videos of full captured shows once we shoot them, edit them, and upload them to the web. You will also get a membership to the "Rock Monster Social Club," which is a social club that will keep you informed on cool double feature film screenings, other underground music, art, and theatre events, as well as a card that you can use to eat and drink for major discounts in select local venues (sometimes as much as 50% off).
 

Non-Locals: You will get links to videos of full captured shows once we shoot them, edit them, and upload them to the web. You will also get everything promised to locals if/whenever you visit the area. You will be invited to join the Facebook group of the "Rock Monster Social Club" that will keep you informed on what is going on with the project. If/when you come to town you will also get a temporary membership card that will keep you informed on cool double feature film screenings, other underground music, art, and theatre events to check out while you are here in town and that you can use to eat and drink for major discounts in select local venues while you are here in town.
 

The funds raised will mostly go to technical aspects, sets, costuming, and makeup (the performers will make their pay off of tickets sold and "pass the hat" donations). We have sound and lights taken care of but need to get a laptop and a few tablet computers to control the software that controls the sound and lights. We aim to also obtain a "backline" of musical amps and equipment so that not only will the house band not have to load gear in & out every night but so we can also put on some cool underground music shows on nights where we do not do the theatre. We also have some reusable sets pieces to build, some costumes to make/obtain, and some theatrical and special fx make up to purchase. Any extra or leftover funds will be used to continue to make set pieces, costumes, and obtain makeup.

Risks & Challenges
Not many risks because, as previously pointed out, we have a venue that is willing to give the room RENT FREE as long as we are producing. We have a great marketing plan that includes many associate partners that are ready to get on board and help us network it.
 
However, as mentioned, we are still behind on some of the things mentioned above and have a mid-October date that is pressing towards us. So we not only want to nail down all of our production needs but we want to impress upon the venue that we know what we are doing, can handle this, and that their vote of confidence in us is not in vain. So, once again, this is why we are appealing to you, our fellow art & theatre enthusiasts.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please use the Indiegogo share tools and help spread the word about us on various social medias that you use ! Please send links to our campaign to anyone and everyone that you feel might be interested in this kind of art/entertainment and what we are doing.
 
Join our "Rock Monsters Social Club: Facebook group. Send us a request so that we can keep you up to date on where we are at and what we are doing.
 

Don't Forget to Rock and to Be Yourself! So little time and so little quality of life that is afforded us in these modern hectic times. You owe it to yourself to breathe, enjoy your friends, loved ones, family, your surroundings and to keep rocking on! Thank you for taking the time to check us out!

story:
black girl love: an adaptation project

Directed by kt shorb and Simone Raquel Alexander.
Featuring Faith Anderson, g’beda, Allegra Jade Fox, and Oktavea L. Williams.
Assistant Directing and Understudy by Deja Morgan.
Dramaturgy by Chantaneice Kitt.
Lighting Design by Rachel Atkinson.
Costume Design by Delena Bradley.
Scenic Design by Iman Corbani. 
Sound Design by Malyssa Quiles.
Intimacy Consulting by Jess Shoemaker.
Stage Management by Megan Kemp and Kiyanna Elliot.
Production Management by Jennifer Rogers.

When: June 7-22, 2019 8pm
“Industry Night” Wednesday, June 19 8pm
Live-stream on Howlround.tv Friday, June 21, 8pm CST
Where: The Eloise Brooks Cullum Stage @The VORTEX
www.vortexrep.org or 512-478-5282

An adaptation of Anondra “Kat” Williams' book of short stories and poetry, black girl love looks at the everyday lives of black queer women and non-binary people. It's a play about our relationships to love, sex, and obsession. In the tradition of a choreo-poem, the show is non-linear and uses original poetry by Williams. black girl love captures the mundane and precious stories of black queer women and non-binary people who have been so long ignored in American theatre. The VORTEX and GenEnCo are pleased to produce this new play by Al(aina) L. Monts for three weeks only at The VORTEX.
 

Why This Project Now

In a time and place where it's common-place to hear people talking about "end times," perhaps it is now more than ever that stories about the joy, love, and desire of historically marginalized people become vital to our survival. black girl love is about how black women love each other in complex, multi-faceted, problematic and celebratory ways. How often do we see queer black women just "be," on screen or onstage

How We Will Use These Funds

Donations from this campaign will go directly toward paying creative collaborators, that are mostly Black women, and all women or transpeople. We have already received a grant from the City of Austin, which will cover much of our talent and materials costs. We are grateful to The VORTEX for underwriting our project through providing performance space and other material goods so we can direct most of our resources toward paying talent. GenEnCo has steadily been raising its artists' stipends over the last few years. The $2000 will insure that trend continues. It is the goal of the Generic Ensemble Company to make creative labor sustainable for all collaborators. Love makes art good, but you can't eat it. Money helps.

Let's Talk About Radical Rush

We are so proud to be partnering with The VORTEX on their Radical Rush program that reserves a bloc of free tickets in the spirit of sustainability, accessibility, and participating in the gift economy. Radical Rush tickets are released an hour before the performance starts--first come first serve. Your donation to this campaign allows us to offer our show to all patrons, regardless of their socio-economic status. 

Why We Are So Cool

The Generic Ensemble Company (GenEnCo) is one of the few troupes in Austin, and nationally, that centers queer people of color bodies and experiences in physically engaged, experimental, ensemble-based performance. GenEnCo has some grants and awards under its belt, and director, kt shorb, has presented work nationally. This is the most recent project aimed at asking profound questions toward social change through rigorous, dangerous, and community-conscious theatre. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help out with donating to our cause, share our project with your networks!

Ticket Info

You can reserve a seat by going to The VORTEX ticketing page.

story:
Lugar, hora y fechas:

Lugar: Little Village Lawndale High School. 

Direccion: 3120 S Kostner Ave, Chicago, IL 60623.

Funciones: 1ro, 2, 3, y 4 de diciembre de 2016.

Hora: 7:00  pm.
 

Quienes somos:

spotlight Entertainment surge a inicios de 2016 con el entusiasmo y talento propios de una compania de teatro musical consagrada a las tablas, compuesta por un selecto grupo de actores, cantantes y bailarines, orquestado por un virtuoso grupo musical con amplia experiencia en artes dramáticas y musicales. 

 

Nuestra producción:

Los Locos Addams "The Addams Family" es una comedia musical de Andrew Lippa, Marshall Brickman & Rick Ellice. El espectaculo esta basado en la caricatura "The Addams Family" creada por Charles Addams para "The New Yorker"

 

Sinopsis:

La historia inicia una noche en que la familia Addams se encuentra reunida en una no muy típica reunión familiar anual donde reciben la visita de sus ancestros que vienen del mas allá par unirse al festejo.

Muy pronto los Addams se verán envueltos en un problema y los ancestros no podrán regresar a su tumba hasta que ayuden a sus mortales parientes par solucionar este inconveniente donde conocerán nuevas personas en medio de una divertida historia llena de amor y unión familiar, dejando en todos la lección de "ser anormal es lo normal" y que "Vivos o muertos la familia es la familia".

story:
MY STORY

I like most professional songwriters, make my living by writing songs about love.  My hit songs SANTA BABY (Eartha Kitt), HOW LITTLE WE KNOW (Frank Sinatra), MOONLIGHT GAMBLER (Frankie Laine) and THE NEXT TIME (Cliff Rifhard) were all songs about love.  Recently I got the thought that it would be interesting to have a show without love songs. A title popped into my head...NO LOVE SONGS. I remembered that through the years I sometimes got ideas for songs of protest, songs that might help make the world a better and safer place to live in. I never made a penny  on these songs so they became "trunk songs"...songs you put away on a shelf or in a box and forget about. .Now, suddenly, I know why I kept writing these songs...in my subconscious mind I was planning a show, a show that would ( to quote the lyric of the show's opener) "BRING SOME SANITY BACK TO THE WORLD WITH 'NO LOVE SONGS' TONIGHT!" There is much laughter in this show and many tears and most of all ..Hope.

story:
Who are the "Ghioceii"

      The theater group "Ghioceii" is an amator theater group that was founded in 1991 by Mihail Sirbu and in 2000 is certified being a Model Group. 
       Its not hard to become an member of this group, but its much harder to resist to hard working and the effort that its needed to be consigned. Actors and director,give different concerts across the country and sometimes are involving in charity actions.
        In last time our troup participate at different national and international festivals where we succed to win the Great Prize,The Festival Prize,the best scenography and the best actor and actrees in main role prizes. We love theater and hope to convince you that theatre is more than art, but its our life.

We need your help...

     Along the time we were sponsored by local guvernament, but as always happen in our country, they always have no money. When we first participate to an international festival at Falticeni, Romania we have spend around 2 months to collect the fund that we needed for, and it consisted only 900 dollars. 
     Now we need 3000 dollars to participate to "Eclairs de Scene" festival,France that starts at 30 of May and ends at 04 of June.Without other people help we will not be able to colect this funds. 3000 dollars is just a too bigger amount for our little 12 pockets. All we have is just a gigantic passion for theatre and a sack full of hope.

What we promote and what we are fighting for.

     Our theatre group promote local culture and habitudes that dies in every single day.Now when thechnologies,irreversible, penetrate all spheres and it's the case to detach your children from computer and show him an alternative way to have fun.
     Now is the time to promote the country's culture to an international scene.

Hope dies last...

     We make call to those who love art, theatre and the beauty.We hope that you will support us with the most modest donation that would help us to realize our dream.

There are many ways to help.
  

      We know that not everyone can support us financially. However, you can help us in a MAJOR way by sharing our story with your friends, family, and theatre fans!

story:
Help Fliss the Mermaid to save our seas!


One evening, while watching Blue Planet on the television, Felicity and I (Greg) were struck once again by the devastating results that human actions have on the oceans of the world, and the poor creatures who live in them. One particular shot, of a baby whale who had been poisoned as a result of toxins passed on to it from it’s mother, because the mother had been poisoned by micro-plastics. We agreed at that moment that we wanted to do something to help save the seas, and to stop things like this from happening.

There are many skills that would be useful in taking direct action, but I possessed none of them. What I had were skills in magic, comedy, scriptwriting and juggling, and over a decade of performing experience, including ten years of touring schools in Italy with a company called Action Theatre in English, with shows teaching the English language. What Felicity had was a large amount of knowledge if marine life, years of experience presenting talks on fossils and marine creatures to school groups with Island Gems Fossil Hunts, and a childhood desire to be a mermaid. 

That evening, Fliss the Mermaid, Curios Aquatica and our mission of ‘Saving Our Seas Through Education And Entertainment’ were born!

Since then we have created our first educational school show, had our first performance, which was wonderfully well received, and a little over a month since we announced the launch of Curios Aquatica we have already raised over £100 for our first nominated marine charity, the Marine Conservation Society UK, mostly from Greg replacing ‘passing the hat’ with him passing a collection pot for the charity after shows at two Steampunk festivals.

But now, Fliss the Mermaid needs your help!


What We Need… And What You Get!


Fliss and I leapt into creating these shows, and we wanted this to be an all-new show, not reusing any of my old tricks and props, and so tricks, props, puppets, a set, and of course a tail all had to be obtained! We called in family favours to get the set painted and some of the set dressing added, and worked hard ourselves to keep the cost down. We also knew that the show had to impress, and in particular that Fliss the Mermaid had to look her best, and so (in the words of John Hammond from one of our favourite films), we spared no expense in setting up the show, and in the end this show cost us over £4000 to put together – a worthwhile investment for the cause we are trying to help! However, with our wedding approaching and real life things needing to be paid for as well, we have really reached our budget limit for the show. Now we have a show with an important message, which means a lot to us personally, and we feel to the world as a whole, and we need help to raise the extra money we need to promote the show, let people know it exists, and start getting it booked into schools and other appropriate places across the UK… and who knows, maybe even beyond!

We are putting time into creating what we can on a zero budget campaign – website, emails, social media, etc, but we need some funds to really get the word out. For example:

•    Advertising in teaching magazines. We have managed to secure a deal with The Teacher magazine for a discount on advertising, but even a simple advert will still cost £180 for a single  edition – more if we want a more noticeable size or position.
•    Leaflets. Greg performs at events across the country with his stage-tricycle, and has a leaflet rack on that where people take leaflets for both his shows and our Steampunk web series The Last Airship – and we have a number of traders at events who are kind enough to take stacks of these leaflets and help distribute them at events Greg can’t be at. We are planning to piggyback on this marketing by creating a three-fold leaflet incorporating the stage-tricycle, The Last Airship and Curios Aquatica. This way anyone interested in either of the other two takes home information on Curios Aquatica too! To get 10,000 good quality three-fold flyers professionally designed and printed will coat about £290.

As you can see, leaflets and a one month advert uses up almost all of our initial goal amount of £500, which is why we have our first stretch goal of £1000!

•    We would be able to start to negotiate deals for advertising in multiple editions of magazines.
•    We can start to write letters and send our information to schools by post – still one of the best ways to get information out. With a second class stamp costing 56p, by the time you factor in stationary it costs over £60 for every 100 letters!

Beyond this, every penny adds to the level of advertising and promotion we can achieve, and allows us to get our shows into more schools and other venues, and teach more people about the harm being done to the oceans, and how we can help! All the way up to our second, way-out-there stretch goal... £2000.

•   We would be able to expand our video promotions with better underwater filming equipment.

•   We would be able to negotiate on a full year of magazine adverts with improved placement.

Obviously even if we were to fall short on our initial goal, the show is ready, we would allocate what we did get to marketing in the best ways possible, and keep pushing our message!

So now you know what we need – how about your rewards!

£5 – A Friend of Fliss – You will get a thank you message, our gratitude, and the warm fuzzy feeling knowing that you have helped us spread our message. You will also get listed on our website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’ as a supporter of our work!

£20 – Badge of Honour – You will get a handwritten letter of thanks, a signed photo of Fliss and Greg, and a pin badge marking you as a supporter of Fliss the Mermaid to wear with pride! Plus of course, our gratitude and inclusion on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’.

£50 – Message from a Mermaid - You will get a short personal video message of thanks from Fliss the Mermaid, translated of course by Greg as she is not use to speaking ‘human’. We can promise each message will be quite unique! If you would prefer, instead of a thank you, we can also record a Birthday, Christmas, Congratulations etc message for you to send to someone who would enjoy a message from a mermaid… and who wouldn’t! You will be sent the video online, plus we’ll send you a pin badge, add you to the ‘Friends of Fliss’ part of the website, and be incredibly grateful to you!

£100 – Mermaid Movie Maker – As part of Curios Aquatica’s ongoing work we will be producing a series of fun videos to get some of the important messages across to a wider audience than we can with our shows – videos that will also help promote the shows. These videos will feature Greg, Fliss the Mermaid, Terence the ‘Seagull’ and Igor the Sea-Turtle. We’re even planning some special crossover episodes with our Steampunk Web Series The Last Airship! At this level you get to be a part of the magic and get an Executive Producer credit for one of the Curios Aquatica videos, plus behind the scenes footage from the filming of that video… probably including me making a lot of mistakes! We’ll also send you a pin badge, put you on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’, and be ridiculously grateful to you for your support!

£200 – Save Our Seas and Sponsor a School Show – Our whole aim is to get our shows seen, and at this level you can make a direct impact on that! Each sponsor at this level means we will offer a free show to a primary school on the Isle of Wight or Hampshire (other areas may be possible, but would depend on us being able to fit the show in around other bookings to save on travel costs!). If you have a particular school in mind we will approach them first, but cannot guarantee a particular school. Following the show, you will receive letters of thanks from some of the students for giving them the opportunity to see the show. You will also, of course, get the pin badge, appear on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’, and we will be eternally grateful for your support!

 

Risks & Challenge


At this point, Indiegogo suggests I tell you the problems in getting this project achieved – but unlike most crowdfunding projects, there aren’t any! The show already exists – any support we get only helps us expand the number of people who will get to see it. So rest assured that whatever happens you can be safe in the knowledge that Curios Aquatica will keep spreading our message!


Other Ways You Can Help


We know that not everyone can contribute, but you might want to help in other ways. This whole campaign is about getting the word out – so that is how you can help in a few simple ways!
•    Share the links to this page on Facebook, Twitter, or wherever else you can! If you want to give us an extra boost, share using the share links on this site, as the more shares we get through those, the more we get noticed by indiegogo and the more they support us!
•    Tell any teachers you know to visit www.curiosaquatica.com and find out more about our shows!
Fliss the Mermaid and I are grateful for every bit of support we receive, be it financial, spreading the word, or just messages of support for what we do, they all mean so much to us, so thank you for taking the time and showing the interest to read all of our information!
