Now we have a show with an important message, which means a lot to us personally, and we feel to the world as a whole, and we need help to raise the extra money we need to promote the show, let people know it exists, and start getting it booked into schools and other appropriate places across the UK… and who knows, maybe even beyond!We are putting time into creating what we can on a zero budget campaign – website, emails, social media, etc, but we need some funds to really get the word out. For example:•    Advertising in teaching magazines. We have managed to secure a deal with The Teacher magazine for a discount on advertising, but even a simple advert will still cost £180 for a single  edition – more if we want a more noticeable size or position.•    Leaflets. Greg performs at events across the country with his stage-tricycle, and has a leaflet rack on that where people take leaflets for both his shows and our Steampunk web series The Last Airship – and we have a number of traders at events who are kind enough to take stacks of these leaflets and help distribute them at events Greg can’t be at. We are planning to piggyback on this marketing by creating a three-fold leaflet incorporating the stage-tricycle, The Last Airship and Curios Aquatica. This way anyone interested in either of the other two takes home information on Curios Aquatica too! To get 10,000 good quality three-fold flyers professionally designed and printed will coat about £290.As you can see, leaflets and a one month advert uses up almost all of our initial goal amount of £500, which is why we have our first stretch goal of £1000!•    We would be able to start to negotiate deals for advertising in multiple editions of magazines.•    We can start to write letters and send our information to schools by post – still one of the best ways to get information out. With a second class stamp costing 56p, by the time you factor in stationary it costs over £60 for every 100 letters!Beyond this, every penny adds to the level of advertising and promotion we can achieve, and allows us to get our shows into more schools and other venues, and teach more people about the harm being done to the oceans, and how we can help! All the way up to our second, way-out-there stretch goal... £2000.•   We would be able to expand our video promotions with better underwater filming equipment.•   We would be able to negotiate on a full year of magazine adverts with improved placement.Obviously even if we were to fall short on our initial goal, the show is ready, we would allocate what we did get to marketing in the best ways possible, and keep pushing our message!So now you know what we need – how about your rewards!£5 – A Friend of Fliss – You will get a thank you message, our gratitude, and the warm fuzzy feeling knowing that you have helped us spread our message. You will also get listed on our website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’ as a supporter of our work!£20 – Badge of Honour – You will get a handwritten letter of thanks, a signed photo of Fliss and Greg, and a pin badge marking you as a supporter of Fliss the Mermaid to wear with pride! Plus of course, our gratitude and inclusion on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’.£50 – Message from a Mermaid - You will get a short personal video message of thanks from Fliss the Mermaid, translated of course by Greg as she is not use to speaking ‘human’. We can promise each message will be quite unique! If you would prefer, instead of a thank you, we can also record a Birthday, Christmas, Congratulations etc message for you to send to someone who would enjoy a message from a mermaid… and who wouldn’t! You will be sent the video online, plus we’ll send you a pin badge, add you to the ‘Friends of Fliss’ part of the website, and be incredibly grateful to you!£100 – Mermaid Movie Maker – As part of Curios Aquatica’s ongoing work we will be producing a series of fun videos to get some of the important messages across to a wider audience than we can with our shows – videos that will also help promote the shows. These videos will feature Greg, Fliss the Mermaid, Terence the ‘Seagull’ and Igor the Sea-Turtle. We’re even planning some special crossover episodes with our Steampunk Web Series The Last Airship! At this level you get to be a part of the magic and get an Executive Producer credit for one of the Curios Aquatica videos, plus behind the scenes footage from the filming of that video… probably including me making a lot of mistakes! We’ll also send you a pin badge, put you on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’, and be ridiculously grateful to you for your support!£200 – Save Our Seas and Sponsor a School Show – Our whole aim is to get our shows seen, and at this level you can make a direct impact on that! Each sponsor at this level means we will offer a free show to a primary school on the Isle of Wight or Hampshire (other areas may be possible, but would depend on us being able to fit the show in around other bookings to save on travel costs!). If you have a particular school in mind we will approach them first, but cannot guarantee a particular school. Following the show, you will receive letters of thanks from some of the students for giving them the opportunity to see the show. You will also, of course, get the pin badge, appear on the website as a ‘Friend of Fliss’, and we will be eternally grateful for your support! Risks & ChallengeAt this point, Indiegogo suggests I tell you the problems in getting this project achieved – but unlike most crowdfunding projects, there aren’t any! The show already exists – any support we get only helps us expand the number of people who will get to see it. So rest assured that whatever happens you can be safe in the knowledge that Curios Aquatica will keep spreading our message!Other Ways You Can HelpWe know that not everyone can contribute, but you might want to help in other ways. This whole campaign is about getting the word out – so that is how you can help in a few simple ways!•    Share the links to this page on Facebook, Twitter, or wherever else you can! If you want to give us an extra boost, share using the share links on this site, as the more shares we get through those, the more we get noticed by indiegogo and the more they support us!•    Tell any teachers you know to visit www.curiosaquatica.com and find out more about our shows!Fliss the Mermaid and I are grateful for every bit of support we receive, be it financial, spreading the word, or just messages of support for what we do, they all mean so much to us, so thank you for taking the time and showing the interest to read all of our information!

story:
Who am I?

My name is Clare Howe. I am twenty one years old and I am from Nova Scotia, Canada. I love to travel, hike, be outdoors, practice yoga, run half marathons, swim in the ocean and be amongst people. I have a tremendous heart for missions and volunteering. And this year I have decided to go on the World Race.

What is the World Race?

The World Race - is an eleven month mission trip where participants travel to eleven different countries partnering alongside missionaries and organizations within the host country. Upon arrival to each country, each team of participants partners with a local contact and is housed for  the month. We work alongside the missionaries ministry and volunteer work.

What type of ministries and volunteer work will I be doing?

We will partner with orphanages, refugee camps, local churches, homeless shelters, minister to women and children trapped in prostitution as a result of human trafficking and other humanitarian organizations. Each country varies in the volunteer work we will be doing. I won't know until I arrive in each country. I am looking forward to be delightfully surprised by each type of volunteer work I will be doing. It will be especially moving to work amongst the poor, homeless, orphans, prostitutes, refugees, sick and burdened. It is an integral part for us to facilitate, support, serve and love people who are less fortunate then us. 

I especially am looking forward to working in orphanages and with kids camps. I have a heart for children. I love delighting and seeing their fascination about the world. I have had the privilege on a couple of occasions to volunteer at kids camps. One in particular was in Bordeaux, France. We played sports, sang and had small group discussions.

Bordeaux, France. July 2012

I used to be a children's swim instructor and coach. I currently volunteer as a Sunday School teacher at my Church.

Another time enjoying the company of children in Egypt

                                                          Luxor, Egypt. May 2012


Where will I be going?

My World Race squad leaves in July 2015. We will be traveling to India, Nepal, Cambodia, Thailand, Malaysia, Botswana, Swaziland, South Africa, Dominican Republic, Haiti and Jamaica. The key reason that I was drawn to the World Race was because of its diversity. I love that I will have the opportunity to travel to eleven different countries, interacting with distinct cultures and serve others in a multitude of ways, over the course of a year.

What will the funds be going to?

The funding I receive through this campaign will cover all the costs of my plane tickets, other transportation costs, travel insurance, ministries, housing and food. It does not include my gear, vaccinations and extra money for outings while on the World Race.

Why should I support Clare Howe's World Race?

You believe that making a difference in lives that are less fortunate than ours is important. You love seeing people being provided with love and care through volunteering. Perhaps, deep down you would love to do the WR and are encouraged to support the cause. Either way, I appreciate it, you make my Race. 

What's in it for you?

By supporting this campaign you will get the satisfaction of helping me depart on my World Race in July 2015. Dependant on the increments you donate you will receive a combination of a thank you card, two bracelets, a fridge magnet and a World Race t-shirt.  View the perks on the right hand side.  


Any Questions?

email me at: clarediannehowe@gmail.com

check out my blog at : http://clarehowe.theworldrace.org/

I would love to hear from you! 


Here are a few pictures and descriptions of what I will be doing in each country~

Varanasi, India

With nearly a sixth of the world's population within its borders, India is a country bursting with people and culture. Home to a diverse array of beliefs from Hinduism to Islam, to a blend of folk religions and other faiths, it is a country of pluralism with twenty-nine languages spoken by over a million native speakers, multiple religions, cuisine, socio-economic classes, and political parties. India's struggles with poverty and crimes of human trafficking, forced prostitution, religious persecution, and more.

                                                                 Kathmandu, Nepal

Home to Mount Everest, the world's tallest mountain, Nepal literally sits on top of the world. In addition to adventurous experiences you will have here, you may also visit widows and orphans in their times of distress and protect the innocent who are prey to human traffickers.

                                                            Angkor Wat, Cambodia

Cambodia houses one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Angkor Wat, a Hindu temple and monastery built during the Khmer empire in the 12th century. It later became a Buddhist complex a century later, and today, just over 96% of Cambodia is Buddhist. Almost 30 years ago, 1.5 million Cambodians died at the hands of Pol Pot, American bombings and the Khmer Rouge regime. Today, Cambodia is a source, transit point, and destination of human trafficking. Unfortunately, the government is struggling to stop it. The people of Cambodia are thirsty for the hope.

                                           The Floating Market, Bangkok, Thailand

Approximately 600,000 people live with HIV/AIDS in Thailand. With nearly two million people estimated to be forced into prostitution, it has become one of the most popular places for sex tourism. Change lives in the city-where you might befriend prostitutes-or in the countryside-where you may serve youth and care for orphans.

 .

Batu Caves, Malaysia

The Ndebele, Botswana

Although it’s one of the most sparsely populated countries in the world, Botswana has the second highest HIV infection rate, next to Swaziland, its southern neighbor. The land itself struggles with drought and desertification yet boasts the largest elephant population in the world in one of its national parks

Swaziland

The Kingdom of Swaziland is one of the last remaining monarchies in Africa. Home to 1.1 million people and breathtaking scenic views, it's also where the world's highest HIV/AIDS infection rate lives (26.1% in adults and over 50% of adults in their 20s). It's estimated that by 2050, Swaziland may cease to exist. Young orphans are scattered throughout this nation in desperate need of attention. Here, you’ll most likely find yourself involved in a variety of outreaches, including education, orphan care and providing meals.

                                                      Cape Town, South Africa

While it's been several decades since apartheid has formally ended, there’s still more healing and reconciliation to take place in South Africa. One of the wealthiest countries on the continent yet much of the population living outside the cities is poor. Like the rest of sub-Saharan Africa, this country struggles with a high rate of AIDS/HIV. Host to the 2010 World Cup and breathtaking natural attractions.




                                                          Dominican Republic

The Dominican Republic shares the island of Hispaniola in the Caribbean with Haiti. Dominican culture is lively, vibrant, and warm. After the earthquake in Haiti, the DR quickly became a refuge for thousands who were displaced. Chances for ministry here are varied and exciting – anything from children’s camps to church planting to construction.



                                                    Carnival des Fleurs, Haiti

Haiti was hit with a life-altering earthquake on January 12, 2010. The nation's still in shambles, this is an opportunity to help with reconstruction efforts and partner alongside local Churches. 



                                                                     Jamaica

Jamaica’s lush mountains descend to white, sandy beaches. The smell of coffee and jerk spices drift in the air. But high in the hills, families crowd into ramshackle houses, little more than sheds. Homelessness is rampant and mothers abandon children they can’t feed. From serving in food kitchens to helping with sports ministry or VBS at a school for the blind and hearing impaired, there is a lot your team could do to serve the people of Jamaica.


What do I anticipate will happen?

Through the World Race, I anticipate a further deepening of my faith, learning more about different cultures, seeing new lands, enriching myself with people's stories and reflections. I also hope to learn more of who God intends for me to be. Through serving others, I look forward to my personal and relational growth. I realize that my efforts will not change the world, but they may change one life. We are all called to serve in our own unique way. In the Bible in Proverbs 3:27-28 it says "Do not withhold good from those who deserve it, when it is in your power to act. Do not say to your neighbor, Come back later; I'll give it tomorrow, when you now have it with you.”

I am encouraged by these words to act, go and serve. I look forward to being surrounded by God's creation and realizing that the world is much bigger and more glorious then I could ever imagine. I look forward to contributing my small part in God’s plan.

Thank you for being part of this adventure. I am eager to go and meet many people, whom I will share the love and fellowship with. Thank you for your love and support in joining together with me in this exciting mission adventure.

With Love,



The best site to travel with me during this adventure is at: http://clarehowe.theworldrace.org/

Here is short video about the World Race https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BiYUDhkLpTw

story:
The Mischief Night Conundrum Theatrical Spectacular

Each year the night before Halloween, The Fricks appear at a location to reveal something spectacular to ring in our favorite day of the year. Each Mischief Night Conundrum is different, you never know what will happen next!

 

What We Need

We pride ourself on our ambitious technical production quality. The money raised goes directly towards world building and giving artists the necessary resources to explore their vision while working with us and the project. 

Technologies include:

  • Projectors
  • Video cameras
  • Theatrical lighting
  • Software
  • Creative technologists
  • Audio equipment

 

Other ways you can help

Email us at hello.thefricks@gmail.com to:

  • Donate or offer discounted/used equipment to us!
  • Contact us about future shows
  • Contact us about collaborating with us

To learn more about The Fricks and The Mischief Night Conundrum Theatrical Spectacular please visit our website, wearethefricks.com.

We appreciate your support greatly, thank you for helping artists bring the human condition to life in innovative and undiscovered ways. We look forward to seeing you at our next production!

ALL DONORS WHO DONATE OVER $5 WILL RECEIVE 2 STICKERS FROM THE FRICKS!

We will be in touch about delivery !

story:
Who We Are

We are a Nipissing University and Canadore College student group which shares a love for the theatre and this year we are reaching out to the community for support for our final show of the year, Sweeney Todd, and as we prepare for our upcoming 2018-2019 season.

Our club puts on a minimum of three full-scale productions every year and is entirely student run. Our executive, directors, actors and crew are all volunteers and work for 3-6 months in rehearsals to bring shows we are passionate about to the community.

For many of the students, university or college is their first time away from home and the club provides a safe space where they can learn and create and grow. 

The funds we are looking to raise will help cover the costs of our productions: show royalties, costumes, props, and sets. This previous year we had over fifty students involved in four productions and these funds will enable us to continue to grow and expand with our membership.

Sweeney Todd

This April 14th Students on Stage is proud to present our first full-length musical, Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

All of our rewards involve Sweeney; however, if you want to support the club, but are not fond of blood and cannibalism put into song you can exchange your Sweeney tickets for any of shows next year (every year involves a literary and/or family friendly show). 

This is a special presentation where we have partnered with members of the community to raise funds for the club and Amelia Rising.

If you can't give a monetary donation at this time please remember to share our campaign with your friends!

SYNOPSIS
An infamous tale, Sweeney Todd, an unjustly exiled barber, returns to nineteenth century London, seeking vengeance against the lecherous judge who framed him and ravaged his young wife. The road to revenge leads Todd to Mrs. Lovett, a resourceful proprietress of a failing pie shop, above which, he opens a new barber practice. Mrs. Lovett's luck sharply shifts when Todd's thirst for blood inspires the integration of an ingredient into her meat pies that has the people of London lining up... and the carnage has only just begun!

NOT RECOMMENDED FOR CHILDREN.

Music and Lyrics by STEPHEN SONDHEIM

Book by HUGH WHEELER

From an Adaptation by CHRISTOPHER BOND

Originally Directed on Broadway by HAROLD PRINCE

Orchestrations by Jonathan Tunick

Originally Produced by Broadway by Richard Barr, Charles Woodward, Robert Fryer, Mary Lea Johnson, Martin Richards in Association with Dean and Judy Manos

SWEENEY TODDIs presented through special arrangement with Musical Theatre International (MTI).All authorized materials are also supplied by MTI.www.MTIShows.com

This previous year we had over fifty students involved in four productions and these funds will enable us to continue to grow and expand with our membership.

Sweeney Todd
This April 14th Students on Stage is proud to present our first full-length musical, Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.All of our rewards involve Sweeney; however, if you want to support the club, but are not fond of blood and cannibalism put into song you can exchange your Sweeney tickets for any of shows next year (every year involves a literary and/or family friendly show). This is a special presentation where we have partnered with members of the community to raise funds for the club and Amelia Rising.If you can't give a monetary donation at this time please remember to share our campaign with your friends!SYNOPSISAn infamous tale, Sweeney Todd, an unjustly exiled barber, returns to nineteenth century London, seeking vengeance against the lecherous judge who framed him and ravaged his young wife. The road to revenge leads Todd to Mrs. Lovett, a resourceful proprietress of a failing pie shop, above which, he opens a new barber practice. Mrs. Lovett's luck sharply shifts when Todd's thirst for blood inspires the integration of an ingredient into her meat pies that has the people of London lining up... and the carnage has only just begun!NOT RECOMMENDED FOR CHILDREN.Music and Lyrics by STEPHEN SONDHEIMBook by HUGH WHEELERFrom an Adaptation by CHRISTOPHER BONDOriginally Directed on Broadway by HAROLD PRINCEOrchestrations by Jonathan TunickOriginally Produced by Broadway by Richard Barr, Charles Woodward, Robert Fryer, Mary Lea Johnson, Martin Richards in Association with Dean and Judy ManosSWEENEY TODDIs presented through special arrangement with Musical Theatre International (MTI).All authorized materials are also supplied by MTI.www.MTIShows.com

story:
Who We Are

More that just a flamenco company, Mojácar Flamenco is the ongoing adventure of two artists, composer Stephen Dick, and choreographer Katerina Tomás, who share a passion for flamenco, creativity, expression and each other.

Since 1996, Mojácar Flamenco has been a unique voice in flamenco, blending traditional flamenco with elements of jazz, classical music, modern dance and theater.

 

What We're Doing

In June 2020, Mojacar Flamenco will present Toque Jondo, an evening of flamenco dance theater, based on the poetry of Federico Garcia Lorca and the music of Manuel De Falla, at the historic El Portal Theater in Los Angeles.

Flamenco illuminates those moments that balance on a knife’s edge,  when love stares down fear and life conquers despair. With powerful rhythms, striking imagery and expressive storytelling, Toque Jondo blends flamenco with elements of opera, jazz and ballet to tell three stories about  lives suspended between love and despair.

  • Cantan Los Fuegos: Manuel de Falla's classic story of love and betrayal, El Amor Brujo is reimagined as a flamenco jazz ballet driven by Latin rhythms with echoes of '60's  jazz.
  • Romance Sonambulo: Based on Lorca's poem, this is a tragic story of two lovers separated at the edge of life, desperate to be reunited before they are enveloped in darkness.
  • Nana Del Caballo Grande: Based on the lullaby from Lorca's play, Bodas de Sangre, this piece tells the story of a young family traveling by night, surrounded by forces that threaten to destroy them.

Visit the Toque Jondo Webpage to learn more about these groundbreaking works.

 

What We Need

After eight years in development, we're ready to bring Toque Jondo to the stage. Long before the curtain goes up on opening night, there will be a lot to do, including:

  • Rehearsals for twelve dancers and four musicians
  • Studio recording for ten musicians
  • Theater rental and professional support
  • Marketing and publicity expenses

We need to raise $10,000 to cover these pre-show costs.

 

Please Join us

We hope you'll help us to reach our goal. As thanks for your support, we invite you to be a part of the creative process as we build towards opening night. You may choose to come to our rehearsals or recording sessions, enjoy VIP seats at the show, or join us for opening or closing night festivities. Your generous support will be recognized online and in the printed program.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are great and we can't wait to see you at the show, but you can also help us to spread the word by sharing this campaign on all social media platforms, through email, and word of mouth. Thank you for your support!

 

Abrazos,

Mojácar Flamenco

story:
Campaign Overview

You can become an essential component in enriching the lives of 25 youth ages 10-18 from under-served communities in Baltimore City by supporting Dance to Dream. Your contribution will allow young people to engage in a weekend filled with dance so that they may learn to “Dance TO Dream” ultimately playing a unique role in their development.

Our Story

Kiara Nicole is on a mission to inspire the youth of Baltimore City through the art of dance! A product of Maryland public school systems, Kiara  understands the importance of exposing inner-city youth to the arts in a positive and healing way. “Dance TO Dream” aims to create a safe space for Baltimore City youth allowing them to come together to take part in the celebration, creation, and appreciation of an age old art form.

Short Summary

Dance TO Dream is a 3 day interactive dance intensive with the capacity to host 25 youth of Baltimore city with a free community showcase at the conclusion of the intensive that will include performances by the attendees as well as guest artists.

The primary goal of the weekend intensive is to engage with youth ages 10-18 through dance in order to assist them in reaching their artistic potential. The intensives include classes in contemporary ballet, modern, hip-hop and West African dance as well as health/wellness and nutrition courses. A mother/daughter fitness class will also be offered. All courses will be administered by regional dance professionals and arts administrators.

Promotion of healthier lifestyles, learning to utilize dance as an outlet to express oneself and the importance of arts education are key outcomes of the weekend intensives.

 

.

Why Dance MATTERS?.

Dance is an age old art form recognized around the world as culturally significant. The art form can be seen throughout history from references in cave paintings to many of today’s viral internet videos. Dance has been used as a form of symbolic interpretation for storytelling to medicinal uses for healing the soul.

The benefit of dance is not only that of increased exercise, but the participation in an art form, which is routed in technique, and creates the opportunity for a creative outlet. Dance also allows for endless career opportunities. Studying dance offers discipline which are easily translatable to other areas in ones life. According to an article in The Baltimore Sun in 2015, despite arts education being seen as a luxury in difficult times, research has repeatedly proven that it significantly contributes to the academic and social success of children during their education and beyond. http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/opinion/oped/b...

There is evidence directly linking arts to brain function according to the “Baltimore at the Johns Hopkins Learning, Arts and the Brain Summit” in 2009, and although it can be scientifically proven, there are severe disparities in the access to arts education in public schools in Maryland. Specifically, disadvantaged youth in Baltimore City receive little to no arts education. “Dance TO Dream” will expose youth to the dance component of the arts in hopes to inspire them to take their own path instead of the one predetermined for them.

What We Need & What You Get

*Dance TO Dream Expenses*

  - Registration costs for 25 youth. 

  - Meals for the duration of the intensive.

  - Costumes.

- Honorariums for teachers.

- Performance Space Rental.

*What You Get*

PERKS, PERKS, AND MORE PERKS :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Participation is not limited to monetary contribution. There are tons of other ways to be a part of “Dance TO Dream”!

Spread the word by asking your studios and organizations to participate and telling your friends & family about our event . Dance is for everyone, Art is life! 

The absolute best way to support us is by embracing “Dance TO Dream” and spreading the word. Tell your friends about this Indiegogo campaign.  Please use the share button to tell people - on facebook, on twitter, personal blogs...


Check out our website: www.kiaranicoledance.net

Like and share us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dancetodream/

And most importantly... come and participate in the classes and support the performance.

                                       Thank you, from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
About "Art"

Dedicated to my brother, Samuel, who has Down Syndrome and continues to inspire me every single day. There's been a BIG leap in representation on TV and in Film for you, buddy. But the theatre...I only know of one play (a non-musical play) that was written specifically for an actor with Down Syndrome (Lindsey Ferrentino's Amy and the Orphans).

New representation is so important for any person who rarely sees themselves on stage or screen. Theatre creates opportunities for expression. In fact, "Art" is all about expression - whether it's expression through paint or learning how to positively use your feelings. With that said, I have always felt a huge responsibility to be truthful in the art I make. It comes naturally to me to write about real people, real life situations. The characters are fictitious, but "Art's" themes of ignorance, stereotype, jealousy, resentment, and love are sewn into the fabric of our society today.

The story of "Art" has brotherhood at its core. One of them, David, is the popular guy - liked by everyone - but plagued by his own insecurities. The other, Arthur, is an incoming freshman in high school. Oh, and he happens to have Down Syndrome. After a decision is made allowing Arthur to join his peers at the public high school, will he find a way to express himself? Will David understand where he fits into a family like his own? Will their parents ever agree on Arthur's progress? 

Where We're At

We have released our Demo Recordings! Feel free to head to our website, artnewmusical.com to download it! This was a labor of love and the performers featured are the most amazing. 

  • We have social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube) which gain new supporters each day.
  • Partnership with a fundraising platform to raise money for the National Down Syndrome Society.
  • A first draft of our script has been finished, rounding out our one act, 90-minute musical.

Where We Hope To Be (with your help!)

We want to put our Demo Recording on iTunes, Spotify and more! With releasing a Demo Recording, there were many factors (financially) that came into play. Hiring performers, using audio software and studio equipment isn't cheap! But, we knew to produce these demos, it would be worth it. There are also some future costs to think about as we move forward in the writing/performance process:

  • A staged reading - the musical on its feet, the first time for an audience, open to the public.
  • New songs to be demo'd in the studio (not for public release).
  • Reaching out to producers, hopefully having a concert production produced in Nashville.
  • Fully staged production within the next 7-8 months.

Risks & Challenges

As with any artistic venture, there will always be bumps in the road. In fact, a big bump that could potentially happen is that the theatre world isn't ready for a musical quite like this and the response ends up being mixed. We are confident that this story is universal: one of love, and acceptance. A story about siblings finding their way back to each other while, at the same time, starting to leave the nest.

  • All funds raised will be used in the pre-production and draft phase of "Art"
  • Your generous contributions will be used to help us reach more supporters and become advocates for families blessed with a relative with Down Syndrome.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, no worries! Here are some other ways you can help us achieve our many goals:

  • Spread the word by sharing the link to this fundraiser with all of your friends and family
  • Follow us on Instagram and "Like" our Facebook page (Just a simple follow can make a huge impact!)
  • Download our Demo Recordings and share the link for those as well!

Thank you so much for viewing our Indiegogo and we hope you consider donating!

story:
“Laver son linge sale en famille en utilisant pour la lessive les cendres des aïeux.”
- Jules Renard

After the death of her father, Natalie and her homophobic mother are forced to reunite to fulfill his wish of having his ashes scattered in Percé, Quebec. Linge Sale is a new bilingual play about intergenerational queerness, loss, and the Atlantic.

Caitlin Cooke and Anthony Michon in Linge Sale

Director's Note

So often stories about young queer people are coming out stories, but Linge Sale is not a coming out story and it doesn’t end with a tearful change of heart. Avery Burrow dares to put young queer women in the driver seat and asks us to examine what we inherit.

Linge Sale is a love song to all the girls we couldn’t hold hands with in public, or invite to Sunday dinner for fear of the wrath of our parents.

This production is dedicated to our younger selves and anyone who has ever struggled with who they are in the face of their families. We see you, we love you and we hope you find the strength to be vulnerable where you can be, when you can be.

- Murdoch

Caitline Cooke and Olivia Woods in Linge Sale

Cast

Natalie: Caitlin Cooke

Kelsey: Olivia Woods

Francoise: Leigh Ann Taylor

Antoine: Anthony Michon

Team

Director: Emily Murdoch

Stage Manager: Danielle Eyer

Lighting Design: Margot Drukker

Sound Design: Joey Zaurrini

Set Design: Delia Yuan

Costume Design: Avery Burrow

French Dramaturgy: Marie-Michel Durand

“I think we’re moving into a time where now people are writing stories that happen to have gay characters or transgender characters. Linge Sale wouldn’t exist if the characters were straight, but it’s also not a coming out story, and it’s a story about a relationship and about families. I think it’s good to be a part of that wave."

- Avery Burrow

Read full interview with director Emily Murdoch and playwright Avery Burrow here.

 Caitlin Cooke, Leigh Ann Taylor, Olivia Woods, and Anthony Michon in Linge Sale

By donating you will be helping to fund our travel costs and rehearsal space rental, as well as remunerating our cast and crew for their work!

story:
Short Summary

Life in show business for the past several decades has afforded me great opportunities to work with everyone from Meryl Streep to Whoopi Goldberg, Maggie Smith, Ethan Hawke and recently, the Coen Brothers in the movie, The Ballad of Buster Scruggs. Four Broadway shows, twelve movies including Sister Act 1 & 2 and Kingpin, numerous television appearances, five solo shows where I portrayed Harper Lee, Anne Frank's protector, Miep Gies, Willa Cather, Agatha Christie, and even someone named Prudence Wright Holmes! Perhaps you saw Bexley, OH! at New York Theater Workshop where the Associate Press proclaimed, "You're in the hands of a master storyteller!"

I'm running this campaign to raise funds to take Agatha is Missing! to the world's largest arts festival and marketplace, where it will be performed 26 times, over the course of the month of August. I need funds for marketing , producers, housing, and even a  wee pot of haggis and tatties! Over 3,500 shows will be playing in Edinburgh and my goal is to interest international producers, presenters, and promoters in my work; and to transfer that work to tours and venues in the UK, US, and beyond.

story:
Deviance 

Deviance is a theatre/dance piece that tries to explore and tries to understand contemporary social interaction. During the past year, a group of young professional actors have been researching the different psychological and sociological theories around our society and how people react to things outside of the norm. We have tried to understand the impact of Capitalism in out society and how that has guide us to compete with each other instead of helping each other. We are one, even if we are different. 

The Artist

I can say that the time and dedication the actors and crew have put into this project is impressive, and they have made sure that they are able to find a voice for these people who are put aside and label as people who will never belong into the status quo. People with different sexualities, with mental health, with disability, with addictions, with controversial ideas are what these piece tries to understand. The actors have taken the time to explore these differences fully, and they have opened up a voice for these people to speak. But, without your help, it will be hard to finish the process and share all the effort they have done. 

 

Please help us raise the money to finish our piece and allow a space where these people can identify and open up a conversation that affect all of us!

story:
Hi there, my name is Sheridan Riles Garrison and I am the Founder/Artistic Director of Bridging Cultures DanzHouse (also referred to as BCDH or BC DanzHouse). At BCDH, we strive to be one of the most empowering studios within the Galveston metroplex. My vision for this creation transpired through my passion to encourage individuals of all ages; as they explore and express their artistry through dance, singing, acting, mentoring and more from cultures across our world! Although I have always had a passion for music, sports, and history; dance came into my life at age thirteen, not knowing it would lead me on an amazing adventure as a professional dancer, choreographer, and entertainer across the world and in the United States still til this day (Ex. Afghanistan, Montreal, Tokyo, London, etc.). I am thankful for my journey of dance and have grown incredibly through numerous teams from drill team, competition dance teams, dancing for the NFL, AFL, MASL, SIFL, SIHL, ABA, MMA, to dancing on cruise lines and more.

Bridging Cultures DanzHouse is currently raising funds to help complete our state-of-the-art dance and fitness performing arts studio located in League City, TX. We offer lessons for children and adults in styles that brings and unites cultures from around the world to our students. From the typical general fitness, flexibility,and dance to dynamic styles from oversees, such as, Hawaii, Tahiti, Africa, Mexico, etc.

 

Mission

To encourage one another’s gift of artistry and musicality, as each dancer begins their journey with BCDH. We provide aspiring dancers and entertainers with incredibly creative and professional mentors; while offering unique ways to speak with the rhythm of the heart! The world has music for those who listen and we aim to highlight the beauty, heart, and movement it brings about!

 

PURPOSE

The time has come to get our own premises - we've found the perfect place and we need to raise $15,000 by March 16 to pay the deposit and fit it out as Galveston's first performing arts and fitness community dance studio, ran by professional artists from across the world

1) We’ll be able to set up proper membership management software for our dance and fitness center, allowing us to keep secure track of all our students’ details as well as any special requirements alongside their class bookings. This guarantees our students will have a proper bookings/membership system they’ll be able to access, storing details of their classes and performances so we can make sure everyone is getting the right information.

2) We will be able to be build changing cubicles in the changing rooms in addition to the restrooms, allowing our students to have more privacy when they’re getting changed for classes. This is really important for many members of our community, who may feel uncomfortable dressing and undressing around other people.

3) Additional storage in the studios will be created, allowing us to start accumulating stage backdrops and props, staging items, extra chairs, and costumes; allowing us to store and keep track of many items that will be utilized for showcases, special performances around the community, and competitions.

4) A shop will be created in our reception area, providing items for sale, such as, dance attire (gender-neutral base-layer dance clothing), shoes, BCDH gear (hats, shirts, sweatpants, and sweatshirts). Not all our students can afford to buy new; therefore, we will have nice used dance costumes that were one or two time use from previous dance competitions or performances, and car or window BCDH window decals.

5) Specialty items – such as mirrors for each dance room, aerial silk rigs, hand weights and kettle bells, fitness bands, medicine balls, yoga balls, weighted drumsticks, weighted jump ropes, yoga mats,ballet barres, poles, security system, tumble flooring, poms, acrobatic supplies, etc.

6) Miscellaneous - Deposit and legal fees, break room for staff, installing suitable sound and lighting equipment, heating and air conditioning, lockers, lockers for bags, partition walls, 

 

KEY GOALS OF BRIDGING CULTURES DANZHOUSE

1) REVITALIZE YOUR BODY, MIND, AND SOUL IN GREAT SHAPE.

Specialize in social dancing – whether you want to get in a great workout, meet some new friends, learn a new style from a culture across the world, hit the club scene,become a professional entertainer...we can get you dancing!

We believe in the utmost professional quality of training (Qualified staff that the owner has personally trained or danced alongside) and have an array of choices for you to choose from. Walk-ins welcome! Our classes accommodate students to join at any time. All classes are taught in a systematic way until you move to the next level. We offer the following levels of dancing: Pre Beginner, Absolute beginner, Intermediate, Advance,and Adults.

 

2) CREATE A COMMUNITY WHERE BC DANZHOUSE CAN EDUCATE AND UNITE CULTURES.

We want to collaborate musically and artistically, showcasing the skills and talents of our faculty, students, and musicians; allowing them the ability to utilize our platform to grow personally and professionally and extend their reach beyond their local community on a global scale.

 

3) TAKE OUR STUDENTS AROUND THE GLOBE ON A CULTURAL JOURNEY OF DANCE.

Post IndieGoGo campaign, our intention is to film master classes, workshops, events, and stream these showcases and more on location taking you to dance destinations around the globe. Including but not limited to, our Tahitian, African Tribal, BollyX Fitness, Ballroom, Modern, Aerial Silks, and more We want to take you on a cultural journey producing short films to celebrate and showcase the origins of dance,fitness, and movement. Learn to Samba in Rio, Hula under coconut trees in Hawaii or Bollywood on a film set in Mumbai. We will seek out the best and most experienced instructors and bring them to you.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We acknowledge that our project seems to be up and coming across the world, but through research we have found that not only are our competitors limiting their service to girls only of age 5-12; they also miss out on the great opportunity of branching out to new styles or classes for adults and males as well. We truly believe that dancing and general fitness brings a healthy lifestyle as well as pure joy and bliss in who each individual is, as they let go in the moment. This positive impact is simply contagious to all people women and backgrounds, as they take part in our unique classes. Such as, Tahitian, BollyX Fitness, African Tribal, Drumba, and more!


 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Can you help us hit these new targets? Please keep sharing the link and keep making noise - the finish line is in sight and we'd love to be able to offer our amazing students even more...

 

THE IMPACT

Classes with Bridging Cultures DanzHouse provides a safe, supportive and vibrant atmosphere for women, men, and children to move and socialize together. In many ways, BC DanceHouse isn’t focused just on dance. It’s solely about individuals reconnecting with their bodies; not giving into society’s prejudices about gender behavior, beauty, and identity; this is where we as people come together in a space where imperfection is is beauty and celebrated. We aim to have you feeling better about yourself when you leave the studio than when you arrived; week on week.

We are creating amateur adult dance classes back to how the environment should; a fun, physical, sociable space that has absolutely no business undermining your body, identity, or your self-esteem. With the opportunity to attend advance classes for a great challenge or even step it up to compete. Regardless, we have a range of classes and levels, so we welcome students with all fitness and experience levels; as well as offer building rentals and specialty birthday or bachelorette party celebrations.

My vision for this creation transpired through my passion to encourage individuals of all ages; as they explore and express their artistry through dance, singing, acting, mentoring and more from cultures across our world! story:
How can one write an immaterial history of a building evading from mere architectural and spatial concerns? How can the body mediate the social and urban fabric of a city? Located in the centre of Athens on Stadiou street, the imposing mansion Megaro Athinogenous that was built in the last quarter of the 19th century stands out as an example of the transitioning moment in architecture with neoclassical and French neo-baroque influences. Megaro Athinogenous had many lives, from a typical Athenian bourgeois family house, to hosting a bank, shops and a political party head quarter, the building also survived a storm, an earthquake to eventually succumbs to fire. Choreographer Ioanna Angelopoulou’s interest on this now listed building bring into focus the inhabitants of this mansion at the turn of the century. Researching the photography archive of ELIA (Greek Literary and Historical Archive), from fragments, she created an imaginary family album, an ethereal genealogy of ghosts. The mansion bore witness to the first steps of children, several generations of spectres that ran up and down the stairs, slammed doors, sat at lively family dinners debating politics,… What remains are Effigies that imprinted the photographic paper. Angelopoulou created a choreography that re-enact the creation and the apparition of an image, in a constant back and forth between their tridimensional nature that precedes the inscription and the bidimensional movements of effigies that found a dwelling in the photographs. Text written by Yasmina Reggad

Concept, Choreography: Ioanna Angelopoulou

Performers: Martha Passakopoulou, Maria Papadopoulou, Ioanna Angelopoulou,

Lighting Design: Eliza Alexadropoulou,

Music Composition: Ilan Manouach,

Artistic Consultant: Yasmina Reggad,

Lighting Assistant: Tzanos Mazis,

Production Coordination: Delta Pi

* With the financial support of the Greek Ministry of Culture and Sport (2017-2018)

story:
El próximo octubre 2018, en Lima y Ayacucho, Perú, se reunirán diferentes grupos teatrales  (internacionales), vinculados al experimento del método actoral grotowskiano, a presentar charlas y piezas teatrales. Nuestra investigación "El proceso creativo del actor y la experimentación grotowskiana" fue aceptado. Enhorabuena. Así que estaremos del 24 de octubre al 2 de noviembre deleitándonos y presentando mucho teatro.

Abro esta página porque honestamente no tengo el dinero para costear mi pasaje, el cual cuesta $700 y la cuota de $200 que incluye transportación, comida y hospedaje.  Los fondos los necesito para esta semana y/o la próxima, claro que puedo excederse en los días, pero mientras más rápido los tenga, evito que me suban los precios de las cosas.

Esta actividad es muy importante porque influye en mi crecimiento profesional y personal. El teatro lo es todo para mí y llegar a Perú, a representar a Puerto Rico y ver todos los otros grandes exponentes teatrales invitados frente a mí (por ejemplo Eugenio Barba), wow... es significante y gratificante.

Desde ahora agradezco a todas las personas que me han apoyado con la carrera y que siguen luchando para que siga cumpliéndose. Gracias adelantadas a lxs que aportaran a mi conocimiento y pasión. Un abrazo a todos, mucho amos y teatro.

Presentaremos, antes de irnos a Perú, la pieza "Repetición 2", en el Anfiteatro 1 del Departamento de Generales, en la UPR de Río Piedras, del 17 al 21 de octubre. Más información de la pieza luego.

(Estos fondos son para mis costos del viaje solamente. Los otros compañeros también estarán trabajando para conseguir cómo costear sus gastos, no obstante si también desean darle su apoyo, pueden contactarme para aconseguirles sus perfiles.)

story:
What the heck is this?

A film about Beethoven FOR Beethoven, and for the lovers of his music worldwide. Almost every other Beethoven movie is a depressing standard biopic focusing on the saddest details of his life. This film will be a celebrations of Beethoven's music! A Musical with exciting dance numbers set to Beethoven's greatest compositions, and a Comedy showing the funny side of the man.

How is THIS beethoven film different?

This film will try to reshape how you think of Beethoven, not as a lonely miser as he's always portrayed, but as a beautiful man, a poet, an optimist, who despite his body letting his down time after time, still managed to create some of the most beautiful works of art ever created.

But how is it REALLY different?

This film will be in the style of 2011's 'Pina', a film with long stretches that are dialogue free, just two dancers performing a complex story all without words, just using their body to express themselves. Our film will have similar sequences, only set to Beethoven's music, and in the streets of Vienna instead, and with more of a Gene Kelly/Jerome Robbins/Bob Fosse kind of dance style. But like 'Pina' this film will try to experiment with new ways to tell a story on film in the 21st century.

story:
Short Story

In 1949 Troubled Island composed by William Grant Still became the first Grand Opera by an African American to be produced by a major company. The Opera written by Langston Hughes and Verna Arvey is set against the backdrop of the Haitian Revolution. It focuses on a crucial but often overlooked piece of history. This magnificent opera has very rarely been performed beyond its initial run and has ever been seen in full in Europe.

Thee Black Swan Theatre and Opera company specialises in bringing important pieces of work like this to life and will be producing a 10 night run at the Bloomsbury Theatre in Central London in 2020.  We want your help to make this the most magnificent performance it can possibly be and tell this story the way it truly deserves to be told.  We want you to help us build a legacy for this important but underappreciated piece of work so that it can become the cultural phenomenon it deserves to be.      

Long Story

On the 31st of March, 1949 a monumental piece of work was staged for the first time by the New York City Opera. Troubled Island composed by William Grant Still, written by Langston Hughes and Verna Arvey became the first Grand Opera composed by an African American to be produced by a major opera company. The premiere performance appeared to be a hit as it was greeted by 22 curtain calls but the critical reaction was mostly negative. Years later Judith Still, daughter of William Grant Still and Verna Arvey, said that the opera was intentionally panned by critics due to racial prejudice. Due to the influence of the critics, Troubled Island was only performed 3 times by the New York City Opera before the production was shut down. Since then there has only been one performance of the full opera, in 2013 at the Paul Robeson Theatre in Chicago and it has never been performed in full in Europe.  

It is a travesty that this opera is not more widely known and celebrated and Thee Black Swan Theatre and Opera company is aiming to change this. In 2013 Joe Charles the founder and artistic director of Thee Black Swan directed several workshop performances featuring extracts from Troubled Island.

 
 

These were greatly received by audiences and showed there was a real desire for the full production to be revived again. This revival will finally happen in September 2020 when Thee Black Swan will put on a 10 night run of the full production.

Taking place at the Bloomsbury theatre in central London this will not only be the longest run in this Opera’s history but also the first full performance seen outside of America.

Why We Need Your Help & What You Get

We have partnered with the arts council to make this production happen and it will go ahead even if we do not meet our funding goal. So why are we raising money? Because we want to tell this story the way it deserves to be told. Because this production has been so rarely seen we truly want it to be as spectacular as possible and for that we need your help. The music in this Opera is a seminal composition and we are aiming to raise £6,000 add 4 more musicians in order to truly do it justice, so that today’s audiences can experience it as William Grant Still originally intended. 

We are also offering you a chance to become part of the legacy of this production. We are trying to make sure this wonderful piece of work is never forgotten. If we can reach our stretch goal of £10,000 we will create a behind the scenes documentary so that the memory of this show can live on far beyond the end of our run.

Your support is absolutely crucial to us and will help us deliver on the full potential of this magnificent opera. We have a number of wonderful rewards for our backers including:

  • Tickets to the show
  • Posters signed by the cast
  • Have your name appear in the programme
  • A CD featuring an original cast recording from the 1949 production
  •  A cameo role in the show. Appear on stage as an extra during the performance

 

What is Troubled Island about?

Troubled Island tells the story of Jean Jacques Dessalines who becomes the leader of the Haitian slave revolt of 1791. It is about the rise of a new nation and the man who would become its self declared emperor but it is also about the corrupting influence that power has on his leadership. The Haitian revolution was a pivotal event in bringing an end to Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade. This is another reason we feel so passionately about this project. Spreading the knowledge of this history is an important aim we have. 

About Thee Black Swan Theatre and Opera Company

Joe Charles, a professional theatre director and actor for over thirty years including long experience as an actor at the Royal Shakespeare Company, founded Thee Black Swan in 1993, with a groundbreaking production of Dido and Aeneas, to critical and audience acclaim.

The Company was formed to provide the growing number of classically trained actors and singers from backgrounds that are currently underrepresented in the arts a platform to perform their craft

It's aim is to explore a variety of cultures as fresh and exciting settings for its productions. Its wish is to be innovative in its production style and accessible to all, bringing classical and contemporary theatre and opera to audiences, who might until now have felt alienated and excluded from these art forms.

Risks & Challenges

This project will go ahead even if we do not meet our funding goal. Know that any funds pledged will go into enhancing the performance. The coronavirus pandemic has led to the cancellation of many live events. We have assurances from the theatre that this production will not be cancelled and can be rescheduled as necessary.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We need as many people as possible to know about this project. Please share our project on social media. 

Thank you

We are also offering you a chance to become part of the legacy of this production. We are trying to make sure this wonderful piece of work is never forgotten. If we can reach our stretch goal of £10,000 we will create a behind the scenes documentary so that the memory of this show can live on far beyond the end of our run.
Your support is absolutely crucial to us and will help us deliver on the full potential of this magnificent opera. We have a number of wonderful rewards for our backers including:

Tickets to the show
Posters signed by the cast
Have your name appear in the programme
A CD featuring an original cast recording from the 1949 production
 A cameo role in the show. Appear on stage as an extra during the performance

 

What is Troubled Island about?
Troubled Island tells the story of Jean Jacques Dessalines who becomes the leader of the Haitian slave revolt of 1791. It is about the rise of a new nation and the man who would become its self declared emperor but it is also about the corrupting influence that power has on his leadership. The Haitian revolution was a pivotal event in bringing an end to Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade. This is another reason we feel so passionately about this project. Spreading the knowledge of this history is an important aim we have. 
About Thee Black Swan Theatre and Opera Company
Joe Charles, a professional theatre director and actor for over thirty years including long experience as an actor at the Royal Shakespeare Company, founded Thee Black Swan in 1993, with a groundbreaking production of Dido and Aeneas, to critical and audience acclaim.
The Company was formed to provide the growing number of classically trained actors and singers from backgrounds that are currently underrepresented in the arts a platform to perform their craft
It's aim is to explore a variety of cultures as fresh and exciting settings for its productions. Its wish is to be innovative in its production style and accessible to all, bringing classical and contemporary theatre and opera to audiences, who might until now have felt alienated and excluded from these art forms.

Risks & Challenges
This project will go ahead even if we do not meet our funding goal. Know that any funds pledged will go into enhancing the performance. The coronavirus pandemic has led to the cancellation of many live events. We have assurances from the theatre that this production will not be cancelled and can be rescheduled as necessary.   

Other Ways You Can Help
We need as many people as possible to know about this project. Please share our project on social media. 
Thank you

story:
Short Summary

I wanna sell stickers and I want you to get them. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need you to fork up $3.00 for a 3"X3" Sticker. When I divide it up each sticker costs about $1.30 on StickerMule. To cover that cost and any shipping costs to ship it to me and you, I'm adding that $1.70

The Impact

If I sell a lot and make some profit, I will be splitting the money between the following 50/50:

  • Women's Theatre Festival Fractured Atlas- I am not allowed to raise money for my show individually but I will be funneling money into the official fractured atlas. If you want to donate directly to the festival, donate there. 
  • RAINN- (Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network) is the nation's largest anti-sexual violence organization. Because of the subject matter of my play, I would love proceeds to go there. 

Risks & Challenges

If you buy the sticker, be sure to display it prominently. I want everyone to know about my fierce little show. For more information on my show, here's the brownpaper tickets website. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know about my show!

story:
Summary

"Great piece of history," 
- Victor Vauban Júnior, Dramatist at Brother Soul C & T

Years after abolition, the oppression of laborers for economic benefit inspired protests all over and later, reforms to protect the emancipated, to protect immigrants and even those born free in the USA. That makes Ghost Writer more than just another story about slavery. It is the people’s cry and the determination that despite one’s circumstances, you can change the course of your future while helping others along the way. It starts with the seed of hope, germinated in the mind of one’s heart and births a new life from the womb of justice and freedom. 

"I must congratulate you on such a clever, powerful and tightly woven play. The interaction between the characters was dynamic with a back story that reeled you right in, creating a unique tension. I'd love to see it in its entirety. Please put me on your mailing list so I can keep be updated as to your performances." 

Best, Melanie Futorian 
Author of, "Don Alias, Stories of A Legendary Percussionist"

It has taken over 11 years to write this story, but as an American woman of color, I feel it is part of our shared responsibility to remember this past, so that we never repeat this era of our history. Yet as members of the 21st century, we still struggle with greed, racism, human trafficking, and the abuse of workers and illegal immigrants. So while we continue to grow as a human society, Ghost Writer allows an inspired look at the truth of our actions, being accountable, personal perseverance and the joy of hope for all. This is Ghost Writer. 

What We Need & What You Get

Attached to this awesome work is the able director, Ward Nixon (TCA Acting Studio, Hadley Players) and campaign team member, Michelle Hobby. But we cannot do any of this with out your help. A donation of any amount will help to bring the story of Ghost Writer to the stage. 

Here is a sampling of what your donations can do:

  • Secure a performance space and a rehearsal space
  • Provide cast stipends (no starving artists on my watch)
  • Provide stipends for crew (you know so you can see and hear all the awesome effects that make the art of storytelling so engaging)
  • Acquire period wardrobe for cast and crew (Oh, did I mention that this story is based in 1833?)
  • A modest set
  • Photography (for a memento)
  • Theater staff (so you don’t trip in the dark  to your seat.)
  • Minor Matters like legal forms, security and insurance, (you know, in case an electric cigar explodes, wink, wink)
  • Last but certainly not least, to make sure you get a slice of Mama Deah’s peach pie during the intermission (you’ll hear more about this when you attend the play. It's deee-lish!!!). 

Did I mention that you would receive a special perk to thank you for your giving. Keep reading. 

The Impact

If there is no justice, there is no peace. All lives matter but the bottom line is that the pain and effects of oppression are long lasting. Too long actually. Donating to this production will be the difference between just telling this story and teaching generations about the importance of safeguarding our liberties.

Fatherhood

Central to the telling of this story is understanding why the character of our father makes the choices he does. His sensitivity to the times in which he is living causes him to provide a home to the fatherless and to nurture and hold close those longing for their mother. In Ghost Writer, he is both nurturer and teacher, both protector and a standard for justice

Family

If one person can bring about change, imagine the power of two. The power of family is that through values of cooperation, unconditional love and support, we can all experience positive change in our world. In Kellington, unexpected friendships will form in this quest, that bind our characters together for life. 

Challenges

After the comedic hijinks of Roommates, I embark upon the drama that is Ghost Writer, the play. Granted, this is an awesome task, but it is equally thrilling. I am a go-getter, but I’m humble enough to know when I need help. A careful use of resources, collaborating with a talented pool of artists, in-kind services or favors will bring Ghost Writer to the stage. Your donations will not be wasted. So, if you come with me on this adventure, I promise you will be just as thrilled as I and my castmates. After a  lot of hard work at the Uptown Playwright's Workshop, we were off to the festival circuit, including cultural celebrations to share our story. It’s been an amazing year since workshop, but that was just the beginning. Now the work continues.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, if you are unable to assist with a financial donation at this time, please join our mailing list at BrownstoneSteps.com. Like and Follow Ghost Writer on social media. Give us a 'thumbs up,' a comment and last but certainly not least, Share or Tweet. Tell everyone you know about Ghost Writer and encourage those that can to visit our IndieGogo campaign and give. It is greatly appreciated. 

 

About the Director

Ward Nixon (Director) is very happy to be directing Ghost Writer (also directed Family Business). His career spans nearly thirty years as an actor, director, acting teacher and acting coach. He has appeared extensively on stage, on TV and on screen. He currently teaches acting at his acting studio, TCA Acting Studio, in New York City where he resides. He extends his thanks to Alicia, and to a wonderful cast and crew. He is a proud member of AEA and SAG/AFTRA. Contact Ward by emailing him at  nixontheatre@verizon.net.

About the Playwright

Alicia’s creative journey began behind the scenes in broadcasting. In addition to producing Rehoboth For You cable talk show, Alicia has performed with various productions on stage, such as the Afrikan Women’s Repertory, the Ujamaa Black Theater, and at the Theater for the New City, among others. As a writer, Alicia has penned several stories, Roommates, a comedy, two dramas, Family Business and Ghost Writer and the short, Bedford Kids. Alicia Foxworth holds a B.S. degree in Marketing from Virginia State University and a Master of Business Marketing and Media from Fordham University. She has taught marketing and media courses at The College of New Rochelle, and Medgar Evers College.  Member: SAG-AFTRA

story:
The Show

"A unique story teller and comedian, described as being the “The Ranulph Fiennes of British Climbing" - by the Today Program - Andy Kirkpatrick has climbed in some of the most inhospitable places on earth, from Greenland to Alaska, Patagonia to Antarctica. In this new tour we begin where his last finished, arriving in Antarctica with the task of guiding a group of BASE jumpers to the top of one of the 'hardest mountains in the world’.

Cold Mountain takes you on an adventure that is at the very boundary of the possible; physically, mentally and emotionally - a climb that laid bare the realities of modern adrenaline sports, as well as friendship.

Andy also reflects back on a lifetime spent climbing on many such cold mountains - the climbers, the climbs and the lessons he learnt there.

Cold Mountain, like all of Andy's shows, is hard to pin down; a mix of comedy, pathos and brutal honesty about a life on the edge in every sense.

Show Length: 90 - 100 minutes

Contains strong language and adult content

You can see me speaking here (note this was a long time ago... I'm much better now, plus I wear clean clothes)

Bringing it to Bristol

 

Sell enough tickets and I'll do it!

So here's the deal, if I can sell enough tickets to cover all the costs - and yes these are the costs of having a good venue! - I'll do the show in Bristol.  So buy a ticket, in fact get all your mates to buy one, and if we don't hit the target then the event won't happen.  Simple.

NOTE: If I we don't reach the target the event will not go ahead, and non of the ticket sales will go through (so you won't have to pay).

Where and when?

The show will be held at the famous St George's church in Bristol on the 22nd of February at 7:30pm, ending around 9:30pm. 

TICKETS AND PRICES

Tickets are £15 each.

story:
Qui est Lucie Riffon ?

 « Le philosophe doit discerner ce qui est nécessaire, et l’artiste doit le réaliser. »

Nietzsche

Je suis une artiste/philosophe de l’amour et j’ai écrit des chroniques d’arts visuels pour Zone-Art depuis 2012 (http://www.zone-art.ca/author/lucie-riffon/) .

J’ai joué au Théâtre du Double Signe pendant 12 ans de 2001 à 2013. J’ai aussi interprété un personnage au cinéma dans le cadre d’un court métrage intitulé « L’étoile d’un ange. » en 2009. J’ai créé et animé des cafés-philo de 1996 à 2003.

J'ai participé à deux reprises au concours de menterie organisé par les Productions Littorales en 2010 et 2011.  La directrice de l’époque, Petronella Van Dijk a fait de très bons commentaires. Chaque occasion de performer à l’oral, sur une scène, me permet d’ajouter de l’énergie et du rayonnement à ma démarche, tout en accordant à mon public une dose de divertissement, d’humour et de réflexion. J'ai coécrit et réalisé le spectacle « Trouvé l’amour ? » en 2014.

J’anime une émission aux Productions Suggère Bonheur qui s’appelle « L’amour tout nu » (http://suggerebonheur.com/les-podcasts/lamour-tout-nu/)

En 2015, je retrouve le feu de la scène pour vous présenter le meilleur de mon univers créatif.

Témoignages

Il faut beaucoup de talent pour écrire un projet comme le tien et beaucoup d'audace pour le financer comme tu le fais. J'aime rencontrer les gens qui ont du talent et les gens qui ont de l'audace. L'audace...c'est,à mon humble avis ,ce qui manque le plus à la plupart des Québécois. Tu sais peut-être que mon compatriote Richard Desjardins(et oui je suis originaire de l'Abitibi-Témiscamingue moi aussi) a financé son premier CD de cette façon. Je te souhaite autant de chance et de succès qu'il en a eu par la suite.
                                     Jacques Michel


Allô la belle femme Lucie! wow! tu es géniale, tu vas au bout de tes projets, je t'admire tu sais!! Ce sera un plaisir, mais je vais y aller tout simplement avec mon cœur d'amour et à chaque fois que je vais toucher à ton projet il se gonflera de Lumière/Amour... alors lâches-toi lousse ma Lucie envoi la sauce !  xxxGuylaine Gamache 

Le titre est plein de belles émotions.

                                                       Jasmin Racicot

C'est génial, j'aime ça. Parlons-en de l'Amour de toutes les sortes d'amour!! et surtout aimons!! Merci de ta confiance et que je t'aime toi!!!

                                                                                                      Suzelle Tardis

Wow, bravo Lucie ! C'est inspirant !  XX

                                                              Valérie Dion

C’est super ! Ça accroche et la curiosité est là. Lâche pas ton beau travail!

                                                                                       Andréanne Garneau-Vallée

Très belle initiative, je suis vraiment fière de toi! Tu peux compter sur mon soutient ! 

                                                                                                                      Annie Fortier

Démarche artistique

En tant que philosophe de l'amour et artiste ma mission est de répandre l'amour. Quoi de mieux que l'humour pour y parvenir ? Et la scène est le lieu privilégié pour offrir l'amour à l'humanité. C'est ce qui m'a incité à commencer à utiliser mes mots et mes émotions en 2011. C'est à ce moment-là que j'ai commencé à écrire et à parler d'amour avec mes mots sur scène. Parler d'amour a souvent été fait de façon romantique ou en montrant que c'est dans le couple qu'il se réalise seulement. Je veux montrer qu'il est partout autour de soi et en soi; qu'il est multiple et pas exclusif au couple. Je veux manifester l'amour comme souffle de vie, et également comme motivation à connaître l'autre à aimer l'autre comme soi-même.

Ma démarche philosophique se poursuit donc sur la scène, avec humour et discernement. Être sur scène avec mes mots, et accompagnée de ces comédiennes, me permet de dire, de vivre avec le public, mes réflexions philosophiques sur l'amour. Mon art manifeste la vie et l'amour dans des mots et des scènes à profondeur humaine.

Mon art est celui du monde tel que je le vois, c'est-à-dire plein d'amour.

Résumé de la pièce de théâtre "Femmoi l’Amour"

FEMMOI l’AMOUR est un spectacle de théâtre sur l’amour, pour faire voir et pour faire aimer l’amour. L’amour commence par soi-même. S’aimer comme on est, avec toutes nos oppositions, nos paradoxes.

Le spectacle partira d’un souper de filles. 9 filles qui se réunissent une fois par mois pour se parler de leurs amours, de leur vie, de leurs doutes et de leurs bons et moins bons coups. Puis, à partir de ce souper, nous pourrons vivre la vie et l’amour du point de vue ou de la perspective de chacune des filles. À travers ces sketchs nous vivrons l’amour sous de multiples jours.

Nous appellerons les filles à partir du trait de caractère qui leur correspond le plus : Paradoxale, Belle, Audacieuse, Harmonie, Fifine, Ti-Coun, Prof, Grandiose et L’Étrange.

Cette pièce s’adresse aux femmes et aux hommes également; quel mari, chum, ami, père, frère, oncle, grand-père n’a pas rêvé de savoir, de voir ce qui se passe dans un souper de filles ? Voilà votre chance ! Alors que les femmes s’y reconnaîtront, vous, messieurs, pourrez en apprendre davantage sur les dames, un atout de plus pour des relations agréables au quotidien..

Votre contribution, votre argent servira à produire une pièce de théâtre qui se donne comme mission de répandre l'amour dans le monde. Grâce à vous, l'amour pourra se manifester dans le coeur et dans le corps de tous. Car l'amour triomphe de tout !


BUDGET

2 000 $   Écriture ; coach et temps

12 250 $   Scénographie: metteure en scène, décors (conceptions, plan et fabrication), écriture des chansons, composition de la musique, enregistrement de la musique 

10 000$   Captation et postproduction vidéo dans la pièce et vidéo et photos                      de la pièce (Cinéaste : filmer, monter/ Photographe ; prendre les photos, les arranger)

5 000$  Outils de promotion : billets, posters, cartes postales promotionnelles, programmes etc..

29 250$  TOTAL

Échéancier : Octobre 2015 à mars 2016

1er  Avril 2016

Christine Pageault concevra, avec Lucie Riffon, les costumes et elle les fabriquera : valeur $1000.00

P.S. Si nous amassons plus que notre objectif, nous l'investirons également dans la pièce.

La contrepartie la plus élevée, mais la meilleure et qui se nomme LA PRÉSENCE vous fera connaître toute l'équipe en personne. Qui sait, peut-être vous ferez-vous de nouvelles amies pour la vie.

Passez le mot ! Car vous contribuerez ainsi à la production d'une pièce qui parle d'amour et qui fera en sorte que chacun recevra sa dose d'amour !

De plus, vous pouvez toujours contribuer en faisant des activités de financement de votre côté. Dites-le moi et j'y serai c'est certain.
