story:
Theatrefullstop will team with 3 pub theatres to present the 2nd Pub Theatre Festival set to be staged from March – April 2018. This year’s festival witnessed 14 emerging theatre companies present their works at both the Lion and Unicorn Theatre and Etcetera Theatre over 2 weekends in April to supportive audiences.

The aim is to encourage current drama school and university students, as well as graduates to stage their works to a paying audience. The festival will take place over 3 weekends in March and April (Friday and Saturday) and will allow for groups with a max of 3 performers to showcase 30 minutes of work. A total of 20 acts will have the opportunity to showcase their work at one of the 3 venues.

Making your first steps into staging your own works after higher education can be a tough task. There’s plenty to think about as you’re not only creating and devising your own works, you’re having to bear in mind the marketing and financial aspects of a show. What the Pub Theatre Festival looks to do is to create a launchpad for the voices of tomorrow. Everyone has to start from somewhere, and with a little support, possibilities can be endless.
story_txt: Theatrefullstop will team with 3 pub theatres to present the 2nd Pub Theatre Festival set to be staged from March – April 2018. This year’s festival witnessed 14 emerging theatre companies present their works at both the Lion and Unicorn Theatre and Etcetera Theatre over 2 weekends in April to supportive audiences.The aim is to encourage current drama school and university students, as well as graduates to stage their works to a paying audience. The festival will take place over 3 weekends in March and April (Friday and Saturday) and will allow for groups with a max of 3 performers to showcase 30 minutes of work. A total of 20 acts will have the opportunity to showcase their work at one of the 3 venues.Making your first steps into staging your own works after higher education can be a tough task. There’s plenty to think about as you’re not only creating and devising your own works, you’re having to bear in mind the marketing and financial aspects of a show. What the Pub Theatre Festival looks to do is to create a launchpad for the voices of tomorrow. Everyone has to start from somewhere, and with a little support, possibilities can be endless.

story:
Overview

SENSUMtheatre are a devised performance company set up by six students at the University of Cumbria Institute of the Arts, formed in May 2018 during our second year at University. Now in our third year, we are currently in the process of producing, devising and choreographing three new and exciting pieces of work as part of our final module at the University of Cumbria. These productions include: 

  • Parallel (10th and 11th May, Stanwix Main House Theatre) - an original dance theatre production that explores human experience and how our relationship with others can affect our sense of identity. 
     
  • Lady Ella (22nd May, Stanwix Studio Theatre) – a cabaret performance inspired by the life and music of Ella Fitzgerald. 
     
  • Road To Nowhere (25th and 26th May, Stanwix Studio Theatre) – an original drama production inspired by current social issues such as gender inequalities, mental health and how our upbringing and the people around us can affect our sense of identity. 

As a team, we create all our productions from scratch with no initial access to funding. All money raised through our fundraising efforts will provide us with essential materials to help create our set, props, and costume for each performance. This will, in turn, allow us to create the best possible theatre experience for you, our audience. 

Who We Are

At SENSUMtheatre, we wish to bring the experience of contemporary theatre to wider audiences with a range of fresh and exciting performances that subvert traditional theatre values. By using the human condition and the modern world as a stimulus for our work, we aspire to create socially relevant performances that both captivate and resonate with a variety of audiences and their own experience. Using a diverse range of theatre disciplines; including acting, music, physical theatre, and dance, we aim to challenge the social expectations of theatre and live performance – proving that it can be an enjoyable experience for all. 

Our Team

At SENSUMtheatre, we take pride in being a theatre company with a difference. Each company member of SENSUMtheatre is actively involved in the creative, devising and performance process of each project. You can find out more about our team members and their role within the company, here: 

Poppy Rowan: Poppy is currently in the process of co-writing, devising and performing in SENSUMtheatre's upcoming Production ‘Road to Nowhere’ alongside company member, Jordan. She says ‘Road to Nowhere’ has been such a challenging but thrilling experience. We hope to shed light onto a number of suppressed subjects and inspire people to challenge their own way of thinking.’ On top of this, they are taking on the set design, stage management, and marketing, alongside Carmen. She is thrilled to also be stage managing and performing in ‘Parallel.’ After university, Poppy aims to continue creating original works and to remain an active member of this immensely unique company.

Callum Jordan: Callum is currently choreographing and creating SENSUMtheatre’s upcoming dance production, Parallel, alongside Ria John. “Parallel feels like such an important project for myself as an artist as I feel that we all struggle with our sense of identity but it’s never really spoken about and we’re just expected to get on with it. Being able to address this through dance has been a real learning experience not only as a choreographer but as a person” he explains. Callum is also thrilled to be on board as lighting designer for Road To Nowhere. He hopes to continue a career in choreography and movement direction after university and is excited about his future with SENSUMtheatre.

Ria John: Ria is currently choreographing for SENSUMtheatre’s upcoming dance production, Parallel.  Ria is enjoying being able to explore the concept of identity with Parallel as she feels “it is something we all struggle with at some point in our lives. Either we don’t feel good enough or we feel that we're constantly living to please. With Parallel, we hope to prove that individuality and identity are more important than trying to conform to the rules that society sets us. As a choreographer, I feel it is important to talk about these issues and address them in a way that I’m passionate about.” After her time at university, Ria hopes to continue working as a choreographer alongside SENSUMtheatre.

Jordan Tones: Jordan believes that when he was growing up the conversation surrounding masculinity and femininity was never a topic of discussion, fast forward to today and when the conversation is brought up, it quickly turns toxic and further away, we drift. For Jordan’s next production, he is teaming up with Poppy Rowan to create an original drama production ‘Road to Nowhere'. Jordan says, “I’m exactly where I want to be, creating a full production from start to finish, with this production I’m hoping to open a discussion, shed some light on a conversation that gets massively overlooked”. Finally, he hopes to continue creating and learning new methods of performance so he is able to travel and continue working within the arts. Finally, Jordan looks to continue his work with SENSUMtheatre and is excited about the future with such a great bunch of creatives. 

Carmen Teppett: Carmen is currently working on her production Lady Ella, she is loving working on this piece especially working with Ella Fitzgerald's music as she is a huge fan of her and her incredible vocals. Carmen has worked on creating this piece from scratch and is passionate about building and designing the set and lights to create an authentic aesthetic for the performance. She is also working with the team of Parallel as a performer in their piece which she is thrilled to be a part of. Carmen is hoping to pursue a career in performing after graduating from the University of Cumbria and is excited for what is to come with SENSUMtheatre.   

Jayden Malabre: Jayden has been a dedicated company member of SENSUMtheatre from the very start, working in collaboration with the team to produce soundscapes for both Observation1 and Utopia. She is currently taking part in the production of Avenue Q, playing the role of Gary Coleman as part of her final project for University, but continues to work alongside company members in exploring sound, producing soundscapes and show tracks for both their upcoming shows ‘Parallel’ and ‘Road to Nowhere’.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £500 to help develop our business, we have fundraised in venues around Carlisle and our crowdfunding page is to help us reach our goal for our future performances. 

As our company grows we wish to be able to purchase better quality equipment in order to enhance our performances, and in turn enhance the overall experience for our audience members. This equipment will vary from a range of things such as higher quality sound and lighting technology, more marketing products and memorabilia for our audiences, to more technical set designs which are crucial to our performances where we aim to create a new world inside our performance venue.

All of the funds we raise are put towards our companies growth, whether it be for our technology, set or venue hire, we are passionate about building our company and taking our unique productions to further venues in the near future.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to help us on our crowdfunding journey and want to know how you can help, here are a few options:

  • Spread the word about SENSUMtheatre! Like and share our crowdfunding page on your social media page (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram). You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to promote our crowdfunding page.
  • Come and experience a piece of SENSUMtheatre! Tickets are available now for all of our upcoming productions: Parallel, Lady Ella and Road to Nowhere. For more information on how you can get your hands on tickets, check out the Events section on our Facebook page.

Thank you for supporting our journey as SENSUMtheatre. We look forward to soon sharing these productions with you all.

story:
ABOUT ZAYO:

ZAYO is a memoir of dancer, choreographer and creative director Esie Mensah. This piece uses movement and dance to showcase the obstacles and challenges Esie has faced throughout her own artistic career. It is a piece that pays respect and gratitude towards her mentors who have helped guide her along her journey. The combined elements of Esie’s drive and determination along with the encouragement of her mentors helped shape Esie into the person who she is today.

Along with being a memoir, ZAYO is also an ode to Africa with the exploration of Esie’s Afrofusion movement in a new, fresh and contemporary way. In the show, a young man named, Ouhna arrives in the world of Nxi and has one directive: get to his destiny. Through a series of tests that will measure his mental, physical, and emotional strength, he must find what it takes to complete his quest, or the journey will consume him. Director and Choreographer Esie Mensah creates an ethereal future world with performers Kwasi Obeng, Lauren Lyn, Daniel Gomez, Amanda Videla, Shaiann Roach, and Benjamin Smalls in this bold new dance-theatre work about self-discovery, destiny, and personal strength.

The spirit of ZAYO (means future in Zulu) is homage to honour her ancestors. It’s to honour her guides from across the globe. A channel of strength, love and dedication for the people that need to hear it.

ABOUT ESIE:

Esie Mensah, dancer/choreographer/teacher/model, is one of the 2017 100 Black Women to watch in Canada, 2014 Black Canadian Award Winner for Best Contemporary Dancer and the 2015 recipient of the Cultural Promotion award from the Ghanaian-Canadian Association. Esie has worked with some of the industry’s biggest icons such as Rihanna, Drake, as well as Coca Cola, FIFA, and TIFF. Aside from her accolades, Esie is committed to bringing a new fresh genre of dance into the industry. Afrofusion is her own unique style of dance that includes movements from Traditional and Contemporary African, Commercial, Urban and Contemporary styles. Esie has produced several art pieces; Shades debuts September 2018, Zayo and Akoma; that has toured in US and UK.

What We Need & What You Get

I’m so excited and proud to bring this production to the stage this summer. I’m asking for help from our supporters and our community to contribute to ZAYO’s creative team. Our goal is to raise $8000! The majority of the proceeds generated from this campaign will go straight the creative team; dancers, costume designer, outside eye and lighting designer. The remaining proceeds will be going towards marketing materials (posters, postcards, programmes) to spread the word.

We want to make sure you get as much out of this process as you can, and that we can thank you for your contributions. There are some lovely rewards on offer, which you can see on the side of this page.

The Impact

 SELECT A PERK. At every contribution level, we truly value your support and want to give back to you! Simply click on each tier and read about what each perk includes! You can do so anonymously or by letting us know who to thank!

CONTRIBUTE WITHOUT A PERK.  If none of these perks are calling out to you, but you’re still wanting to contribute to this show and cause, simply click on the pink BACK IT button at the very top of the page. You will be prompted to enter a dollar amount for your contribution.  You can do so anonymously or by letting us know who to thank!

 

THE IMPACT. This project is extremely important for me and the team as it was originally created to represent myself and Africans in a positive light and to inspire people, especially as artists, to get through the hump and follow their dreams. Through audio and visual elements,  I’ve used the afrofusion choreography which I’ve spent more than 7 years developing to bring my knowledge in traditional and afrobeat together to tell this unique story.

 

OTHERS WAY YOU CAN HELP

We're grateful for any donation - no matter if it's $5 or $500, to bring this project to life. With your help, we will be able to share this unforgettable story and raise funds for this important production.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!:

Help us to make AS MUCH NOISE AS POSSIBLE by sharing this with your friends, family, and colleagues, and pass on the information to anyone who you think might be interested.

Come to the show! We really believe that we're going to make something special, and want to share it with as many people as we possibly can.

Thank you so much for any support you are able to offer in helping us tell this story!

story:
How far would you go to make your dreams come true?

Based on Michael Uslan’s memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman, Legion M (Associate Producer) is uniting fans to come along for the ride as we work with Nederlander Worldwide Productions on this new one-man stage play based on Michael’s struggles as a blue-collar, nerdy, comic book-loving kid who would someday grow up to acquire the rights to Batman and become one of the most important behind-the-scenes figures in comic book movie history. His wildly inspiring story will delight, entertain, and leave you feeling like you can accomplish ANYTHING.

The team behind the play is led by the world-famous Broadway organization Nederlander Worldwide Productions (part of a family organization that has presented some of Broadway’s most successful shows including Hamilton, Wicked and The Lion King), and they are inviting YOU to participate in behind-the-scenes, exclusive, once-in-a-lifetime opportunities as we follow the journey from concept to stage.  As a “founding fan”, all backers participating in this promotional campaign will receive a photomosaic wallpaper that includes YOUR image commemorating a desire to follow your own dreams and inspire others, along with a special thanks on the play’s website! From there, the perks get even more amazing and other options available include:

  • As a "Founding Fan", all campaign participants will be invited to virtual round table process meetings with the play’s lead Broadway and Hollywood producers.
  • Copies of the trade paperback The Boy Who Loved Batman, from which the play is adapted.
  • Unique signed memorabilia.
  • Live, in-person readings in either New York or L.A. which are typically reserved as industry-only.
  • Feedback about your own ideas from real Hollywood executives. 
  • Lunch with the Executive Producer of every Batman movie in the past 30 years, Michael Uslan himself! 

EXTRA, EXTRA! The Los Angeles Reading has been confirmed for July 19th at the TCL Chinese Theatre in Hollywood. Check out the tickets and the perks that come with them in the Sidekick Package for the LA Reading. 

Update: Exciting news for the LA Reading! Deborah Ann Woll will be joining the cast for this unique event in the Stage Directions role. We are thrilled to have her aboard!

The boy is Michael Uslan, who grew up in New Jersey at a time when comics were for little kids and parents thought reading them would rot your brain. But Michael absolutely loved comic books… they were his refuge from bullies and irate baseball coaches. In fact, he loved them so much, he had thousands stacked in his dad’s garage, and he knew all the stories by heart.

Michael’s passion for comics led to a unique dream… not dreaming of BEING a superhero like many boys his age, but of something a little more unusual… he dreamed of SAVING his superhero. 

Devastated by how his “dark knight” was portrayed as a campy joke in the 1960’s television series, Michael made a solemn vow to find a way to show the world the “true” Batman – the dark and serious avenger portrayed in the early comic books. This vow became Michael’s life’s work – and despite all obstacles – including being a nobody with no connections to Hollywood or to the comic book industry – Michael believed in his heart of hearts that he would be the guy to bring the world’s first “serious” superhero movie to the silver screen – and when he did it, the movie would be starring his favorite caped crusader.

DUH, THAT SOUNDS OBVIOUS

Well, back in the 1970s and 1980s, this idea was not obvious at all. In fact, no one had ever done a serious comic book feature film before. 

The thing you have to understand is that back then, comics were not the super-cool billion dollar franchises that they are today. The Batman TV series was pure camp, and even the Superman movies lacked the dark nuances of the more complicated – and perhaps more compelling – superheroes of today. In fact, no one had ever done a “serious” comic book movie before. So when Michael finally obtained the rights to Batman, Hollywood executives simply didn’t believe there was an audience for his vision.  Every single studio turned him down.

PERSISTANCE PAYS OFF

After ten years of tenacious persistence, never taking “no” for an answer, and following his passion against all odds (including better financial judgment), Michael finally achieved his dream by executive producing the 1989 film Batman starring Michael Keaton as “Batman” and Jack Nicholson as “The Joker,” which was directed by young auteur Tim Burton. 

The wild success of that film proved what Michael knew all along – that the world needs superheroes – real superheroes with inner emotional lives and complicated backstories – superheroes who are more like real people – superheroes who fans can connect to. Despite all the obstacles Michael experienced in pursuing his dream, he helped create one of the most iconic and successful pop culture franchises of all time.

This is the story of that boy. The boy who never gave up. The boy who saved his superhero. The boy who loved Batman.

 

Our society has been through a rough time, and now, more than ever, the world needs inspiration and hope through positive, uplifting stories. Michael’s memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman is the inspirational story that we need, that encourages people from all walks of life and of all ages to dream – and to dream big. This is the story about following your passion no matter the roadblocks, and to keep the faith while facing impossible odds. 

The Boy Who Loved Batman is a story about changing the world for the better – one comic book nerd at a time.

Hearing Michael Uslan tell his story in person – with all the trials and tribulations he experienced over decades of struggling to make his dreams come true – is a rare privilege.

He takes the listener on an emotional journey reminding us all what it means to dream, to struggle, to achieve. We want to give an audience the opportunity to feel the same energy and experience the excitement of his journey from comic book nerd to Executive Producer of one of the most successful film franchises of all time. Indeed, the Batman movies blazed the way for the entire phalanx of comic book-based films. Telling his story in a theatrical setting via a one-man stage play based on Michael Uslan's memoir is an amazing opportunity to bring some inspiration and uplift to the world. After all, theatre as an art-form allows young dreamers to follow their hearts. Don’t we owe it to them to bring them a story celebrating all the sacrifices they make to follow their dreams?

BUT… PANDEMIC?

While the COVID-19 pandemic crippled live theatre in 2020, Broadway announced it's reopening in September 2021, bringing performers and audiences back to Broadway for the first time in eighteen months. This will be an exciting revival of an entire industry, and our play about a dreamer who wouldn't say no mirrors what has happened to Broadway as an industry and to its artists. Being a part of this revival would not only be exciting, but would offer The Boy Who Loved Batman a unique launch pad as it takes off in this new form. 

The Boy Who Loved Batman is also uniquely positioned as a COVID-19 friendly show. First, it’s a one-man stage play, which minimizes the need for a packed house to sustain its budget. Second, one-man plays, by definition, have minimal crew and only one actor, so any current social distancing rules can be followed for the protection of all talent and behind-the-scenes crew. This also means that the show can be written, rehearsed, directed and previewed safely, with minimized fear of pandemic-related repercussions. 

Backing this project means joining Legion M behind the scenes as an amazing team of seasoned Broadway professionals develops the book into a live stage play, including:

Bob Nederlander and Nederlander Worldwide Productions, LLC

Robert Nederlander, Jr. is the president and CEO of Nederlander Worldwide Entertainment, part of the Nederlander family of companies which has been in the live entertainment business for over 109 years. Founded in 2000, NWE is focused on the expansion of the Broadway and Nederlander entertainment brands into new and emerging markets globally. Today, NWE develops, manages and operates theatres worldwide, produces Broadway and related shows in domestic and international markets, and undertakes cultural and educational initiatives. 

Michael Uslan, writer/performer

Michael Uslan is the originator and executive producer of The BATMAN movie franchise, from 1989’s BATMAN to 2019’s JOKER, and the upcoming THE BATMAN (2021). Michael has producing credits on 80 films. Michael acquired the rights to the world-famous computer game, WHERE IN THE WORLD IS CARMEN SANDIEGO?, which won him an Emmy Award for "Best Animated Series." He is currently overseeing The Stan Lee Universe and legacy of characters created by Stan post-Marvel for Genius Brands.

Michael published his memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman in 2011, and the sequel Batman's Batman in 2022, with more than 60 publications to follow. He co-host on-air for Turner Classic Movies: “Super-Heroes in the Movies.” Michael pioneered and instructed the first accredited college course and correspondence course on comic books at Indiana University in 1971, and he co-created and instructed the Smithsonian Institution’s first on-line course on The Rise of Superheroes and Their Impact on Pop Culture alongside Stan Lee and his son David Uslan.

Don Frantz, Executive Producer for Nederlander Worldwide Entertainment

Don Frantz  (Executive Producer for Nederlander Worldwide Entertainment) served as the original Associate Producer of Disney’s “Beauty and the Beast” and “The Lion King.” General Manager for Broadway’s “A Class Act”, “Soul of Shaolin,” “A Tale of Two Cities” and Off-Broadway’s “Summer of 42.”   Producer of Off-Broadway’s  “Disenchanted!”.  Past work includes Producer/Creative Director for Walt Disney World, Busch Gardens and Seaworld.  Creator of the Amazing Maize Maze. Production positions on 3 Superbowls, 1984 World Expo and Liberty Weekend and multiple productions in China including Executive Producer of NWE’s current production of “Sound of the Silk Road” opening July 2021.  

Geoff Cohen, General Manager-Logistics for Nederlander Worldwide

Geoff Cohen (General Manager-Logistics) has enjoyed working with Nederlander Worldwide for these past two years. Prior to that favorite work included: Vice President and Producer for Madison Square Garden; General Manager for Paper Mill Playhouse; Co-Creator and Founding Executive Director of the New York Musical Theatre Festival (NYMF); Executive Director, Shen Wei Dance Arts; and Company Manager for the world premiere of Fugard’s MASTER HAROLD and the Boys. 

Legion M Entertainment, Inc., Associate Producer

Co-founded by two Emmy award-winning streaming media pioneers, Legion M is the world’s first fan-owned studio. Revolutionizing the way entertainment is made with a growing community of over 130,000+ members and investors, the company uses disruptive new equity crowdfunding laws to allow people to invest directly in THEIR company, which then partners with top Hollywood talent to develop, finance and produce a diverse slate of feature films, TV, digital content, consumer products, live events, comic books and podcasts - all backed by a passionate built-in audience of fans. Past projects include the Sundance documentary Memory: The Origins of Alien, Kevin Smith’s feature film Jay and Silent Bob Reboot, the critically acclaimed Colossal, starring Anne Hathaway and Jason Sudeikis, and directed by Nacho Vigalondo, the cult hit Mandy starring Nicolas Cage and directed by Panos Cosmatos, Bad Samaritan starring David Tennant and directed and produced by Dean Devlin, and Archenemy starring Joe Manganiello.

Legion M is an Associate Producer and sponsor on The Boy Who Loved Batman stage play, and we are thrilled to open the gates to Broadway to give YOU the opportunity to come along for the ride!

All For One Theater

All For One Theater is dedicated to producing and developing extraordinary solo theater. Since 2011, AFO has presented acclaimed solo works Off and Off-Off Broadway, including two New York Times Critic’s Picks: The Brobot Johnson Experience by Darian Dauchan and Open by Crystal Skillman; as well as the Drama League Award-nominated digital series AFO Solo Shorts. AFO also nurtures solo artists through the Solo Collective developmental series, in addition to one Artist In Residence for up to 18 months of development.

We LOVE IndieGoGo because we love supporting artists and makers who may not get a fair shake from more “traditional” industries. We believe in following your dreams, and we emphatically support those who put everything on the line to achieve the impossible.

Michael Uslan’s entire life has been dedicated to the idea of following your dream. His favorite comic book was "Batman", his favorite character was Batman, and his career has been built on Batman. We felt there was no better way to bring his story to the public than by giving people who believe in dreams the opportunity to come along for the ride as the play is developed through the readings and preview process, and hopefully on to Broadway in 2022!

You’ll notice that some of our perks showcase a diverse and inclusive cadre of talented artists. We are honored to introduce their work to you, and hope you take the time to get to know each one. They were inspired by Michael Uslan’s story of struggle and achievement, and we hope you are too!

Aziza Andre' (Illustrator, Muralist, Sequential Artist)

Aziza Andre' is an Illustrator from Manhattan, New York who is currently based in Atlanta, Georgia. She graduated from the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2018 with a Bachelors of Fine Arts Degree in Illustration Art. She's known for her portrait work inspired from sequential art and traditional realism. She currently instructs art within the community of Atlanta.

Scott Zenteno (Twitter, Instagram)

Scott is an environment artist based in Pasadena, CA working at Lucasfilm Animation on Star Wars. As an artist, their goal is "to create worlds that inspire joy", the same way that so many stories did for them as a child (and, of course, still as an adult!). 

Chauncey Pierce (Website) 

Chauncey Pierce has been a freelance storyboard artist for over 20 years having worked on feature films, commercials, video games, and music videos. Originally from Chicago, IL he has a lifelong passion for film and art thanks to the influence and support of his parents who believed in the arts.

Jeffrey Veregge

Jeffrey Veregge is an award-winning artist and writer from the Port Gamble S'Klallam Tribe. Best known for his comic book work with nearly 150 covers for Marvel, Valiant, Boom, Darkhorse and IDW. As a graphic designer and artist he has worked with companies such as Nike and Viacom. He 2017 he 15 month solo exhibition at the Smithsonian titled "Of Gods and Heroes: The art of Jeffrey Vereggel. Veregge is also a muralist having created giant murals for Citizen M, the Burke Museum, Snoqualmie Casino and currently for the NHL at Climate Pledge Arena, future home of the Seattle Kraken. 

 

Backing this unique project will entitle you to epic perk opportunities such as invitations to two virtual round table development meetings, exclusive art prints, and even the opportunity to attend early-stage development readings in New York or Los Angeles. You can even gain access to tickets for the show and book private meetings with Michael Uslan himself! This is YOUR opportunity to see how a Broadway stage play goes from the kernel of an idea to the “Great White Way.”

Just like Batman was the hero who saved Gotham, and Michael Uslan was the hero who saved Batman, YOU can be the hero who becomes a part of bringing this story to the stage to inspire more dreamers to never give up.

Access to opening night tickets & after party!

If the play opens, all campaign participants will have the opportunity to buy tickets and get access to the opening night party, subject to availability on a FIRST-COME, FIRST SERVE basis.

Founding Fan Status

When you participate in this campaign -- even at the $10 level -- you are securing your place at the table for two online, interactive process meetings as Michael Uslan and Bob Nederlander work to bring the adaptation to the stage. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to brag to all your friends about how you had the inside scoop on a pre-Broadway play! In general, these meetings will be structured no longer than one hour each. We will schedule them ahead of time so you don't have to last-minute cancel your dinner date, put off working out, or tell your teacher that your dog ate your homework. That's how we roll. 

Inclusion in Mosaic Wallpaper

When the campaign ends, everyone who participates will have the opportunity to upload their photo to be included in a photo mosaic wallpaper for the "Untitled Pre-Broadway Play Based On The Memior The Boy Who Loved Batman"! The wallpaper will be portrait orientation, and it will fit most phone sizes. 

Mosaic is a sample; not final image.

Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Silver Backer

When you participate in the Vigilante Package, the Joker Package, The Utility Belt Package, & the Dark Knight Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Silver Backer! 

Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Gold Backer

When you participate in the Bat Cave Package, the Daydreamer Package, or the Hero Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Gold Backer! 

Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Platinum Backer

When you participate in the Sidekick Package, the Killing Joke Package, the POW! Package, the Detective Package, or the Ultimate Hero Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Platinum Backer and be given the highest exposure and priority! 

Personal Video (Michael Uslan)

Michael Uslan is not only a dreamer, but a doer and an icon! With the Hero Package, you will receive a personalized shoutout video from Michael Uslan addressed to you or someone you care about. Only 15 opportunities for backers!

Invite to LA or NYC for early reading of play

A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! With the "Sidekick" Package, you will receive 2 tickets to a pre-opening reading of the play. These intimate readings are traditionally reserved for industry professionals and play investors only, and are used to tweak the content of the play as part of its early development process. By participating in this campaign, you will have the opportunity to get the "inside scoop" with a behind-the-scenes look! These readings are only taking place in New York & Los Angeles, travel expenses and lodging are not included. The New York reading is scheduled for two dates - June 29th & June 30th (subject to change). When you purchase NY reading tickets, you may be placed on either date. The LA reading is confirmed for Monday, July 19th 6:30pm-8:30pm PT at the historic Chinese Theatre in Hollywood. All backers will be required to sign an NDA prior to entrance and NO recording of any kind will be allowed. Proof of a COVID-19 vaccine will be required for entry. Early bird pricing available now with the "Sidekick" Package; ticket prices will rise closer to the events.

Get feedback on your script

The Detective Package offers you the opportunity to have the Legion M development team read, evaluate, and provide you with in-depth notes for your screenplay, book, treatment or comic book, gaining feedback about your project from professional producers and writers in the industry. Project review will take up to six months to complete, and are subject to the availability of the executives giving direct feedback. This is only available for 10 total backers.

1-hr Zoom with Legion M execs

Making it in Hollywood in hard! If you have burning questions about how to break into the business, or want to pick our brains about start-ups, Legion M's executive team will be happy to  give you some pointers! This business is all about who you know, so come get to know us! The Legion M Executive team is offering a very limited amount of these opportunities - only 10 total! 

10-min zoom with Michael Uslan

To celebrate the development of this pre-Broadway play, producer & writer Michael Uslan is offering the chance to have a chat with him about following your dreams and never giving up! In the Killing Joke Package, you'll get a 10 minute conversation with Michael Uslan to discuss his story of never taking no for an answer and making the impossible happen. Come be inspired. Only 20 spots available! 

Script signed by Michael Uslan

At the Daydreamer Package level, you will be given a physical copy of the script of the play, signed by Michael Uslan! This item is extremely limited and will only be given to 100 total backers. The script will be printed, bound, and will be watermarked with each backer's name. Each backer must agree to sign an NDA before the script will be released to that backer. The timing of this release is at the sole discretion of the play's executive team and may be after the play premieres.

Lunch with Michael Uslan (NY or LA only)

Imagine having lunch with a billion-dollar feature film franchise producer in Hollywood -- NOW YOU CAN! Michael Uslan is giving the opportunity of a lifetime to only 4 total backers to sit down & chow down with him in either New York or Los Angeles. Dates are TBD and subject to Michael's availability. All lunch dates will be vetted prior to confirmation of meeting. No pitches please. Travel and lodging not included.

BWLB Art Print (Mini Poster)

You will receive an art print by one of our extremely talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story full of inspiration and courage. In an 11x17 size, this art print will be one to frame for your wall. 

BWLB Trade Paperback

Meet the man whose life-long quest to reclaim the true, cool soul of Batman wonderfully transformed today's comic book movies. Growing up outside Asbury Park, New Jersey, Michael Uslan was obsessed with comic books. He'd be the first to grab the latest issues off the shelves from his local comic book store, including four copies of the now legendary Fantastic Four #1. His favorite superhero was the brooding, crime-fighting vigilante, Batman. Despising the campy 1960s TV show, Uslan became determined to bring the real Batman—dark, serious, burdened by a tragic past—to the silver screen. Undeterred by Hollywood's initial lackluster response, after a ten-year human endurance contest in which every major movie studio turned him down, Uslan went on to become Executive Producer on every modern Batman film, beginning with Tim Burton's widely hailed Batman in 1989 to Christopher Nolan's celebrated Dark Knight trilogy and well beyond. Warmly told and inspiring, Uslan's remarkable story is a testament both to the profound imaginative power of comic book heroes and the tenacity of the New Jersey boy determined to bring one of them to life. This second edition includes a special foreword and afterword by Uslan, bringing us up to date on everything Batman.

BWLB art print postcards (x4)

You will receive four postcards, each featuring the art created by our talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story.

BWLB Alt Mini Posters (x3)

You will receive the other 3 art prints by all of our extremely talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story full of inspiration and courage. All will come in 11x17 sizes, perfect for your wall. 

BWLB Exclusive Pin

This exclusive luxury enamel pin will feature art inspired by Michael Uslan's story of bravery and never giving up. 

Help us reach our stretch goals to unlock more perks! 

  • If we hit $25,000, it will unlock a t-shirt for anyone who contributed $250 or more and a discounted add-on price for everyone else. 
  • If we hit $50,000, it will unlock a surprise for all backers! 

*Note: Participating in this campaign does not constitute an investment into play based on the memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman, nor is it an investment into Legion M. To learn about how you can own a stake in Legion M, go to http://legionm.com/join-the-legion.

Full disclosure… getting a show from concept to the Broadway stage is tough. Only a small percentage of plays developed for Broadway actually make it, and this play will be no exception. That’s why we’re stacking the team behind the project with superhero level individuals working tirelessly to do everything in their power to realize our collective dream. And while we cannot guarantee that the play will ultimately be mounted, all IndieGoGo perks outside of access to play tickets will be fulfilled.

Dare to dream… and join us in this journey to Broadway!
story_txt:
How far would you go to make your dreams come true?Based on Michael Uslan’s memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman, Legion M (Associate Producer) is uniting fans to come along for the ride as we work with Nederlander Worldwide Productions on this new one-man stage play based on Michael’s struggles as a blue-collar, nerdy, comic book-loving kid who would someday grow up to acquire the rights to Batman and become one of the most important behind-the-scenes figures in comic book movie history. His wildly inspiring story will delight, entertain, and leave you feeling like you can accomplish ANYTHING.The team behind the play is led by the world-famous Broadway organization Nederlander Worldwide Productions (part of a family organization that has presented some of Broadway’s most successful shows including Hamilton, Wicked and The Lion King), and they are inviting YOU to participate in behind-the-scenes, exclusive, once-in-a-lifetime opportunities as we follow the journey from concept to stage.  As a “founding fan”, all backers participating in this promotional campaign will receive a photomosaic wallpaper that includes YOUR image commemorating a desire to follow your own dreams and inspire others, along with a special thanks on the play’s website! From there, the perks get even more amazing and other options available include:
As a "Founding Fan", all campaign participants will be invited to virtual round table process meetings with the play’s lead Broadway and Hollywood producers.
Copies of the trade paperback The Boy Who Loved Batman, from which the play is adapted.
Unique signed memorabilia.
Live, in-person readings in either New York or L.A. which are typically reserved as industry-only.
Feedback about your own ideas from real Hollywood executives. 
Lunch with the Executive Producer of every Batman movie in the past 30 years, Michael Uslan himself! 
EXTRA, EXTRA! The Los Angeles Reading has been confirmed for July 19th at the TCL Chinese Theatre in Hollywood. Check out the tickets and the perks that come with them in the Sidekick Package for the LA Reading. Update: Exciting news for the LA Reading! Deborah Ann Woll will be joining the cast for this unique event in the Stage Directions role. We are thrilled to have her aboard!The boy is Michael Uslan, who grew up in New Jersey at a time when comics were for little kids and parents thought reading them would rot your brain. But Michael absolutely loved comic books… they were his refuge from bullies and irate baseball coaches. In fact, he loved them so much, he had thousands stacked in his dad’s garage, and he knew all the stories by heart.Michael’s passion for comics led to a unique dream… not dreaming of BEING a superhero like many boys his age, but of something a little more unusual… he dreamed of SAVING his superhero. Devastated by how his “dark knight” was portrayed as a campy joke in the 1960’s television series, Michael made a solemn vow to find a way to show the world the “true” Batman – the dark and serious avenger portrayed in the early comic books. This vow became Michael’s life’s work – and despite all obstacles – including being a nobody with no connections to Hollywood or to the comic book industry – Michael believed in his heart of hearts that he would be the guy to bring the world’s first “serious” superhero movie to the silver screen – and when he did it, the movie would be starring his favorite caped crusader.DUH, THAT SOUNDS OBVIOUSWell, back in the 1970s and 1980s, this idea was not obvious at all. In fact, no one had ever done a serious comic book feature film before. The thing you have to understand is that back then, comics were not the super-cool billion dollar franchises that they are today. The Batman TV series was pure camp, and even the Superman movies lacked the dark nuances of the more complicated – and perhaps more compelling – superheroes of today. In fact, no one had ever done a “serious” comic book movie before. So when Michael finally obtained the rights to Batman, Hollywood executives simply didn’t believe there was an audience for his vision.  Every single studio turned him down.PERSISTANCE PAYS OFFAfter ten years of tenacious persistence, never taking “no” for an answer, and following his passion against all odds (including better financial judgment), Michael finally achieved his dream by executive producing the 1989 film Batman starring Michael Keaton as “Batman” and Jack Nicholson as “The Joker,” which was directed by young auteur Tim Burton. The wild success of that film proved what Michael knew all along – that the world needs superheroes – real superheroes with inner emotional lives and complicated backstories – superheroes who are more like real people – superheroes who fans can connect to. Despite all the obstacles Michael experienced in pursuing his dream, he helped create one of the most iconic and successful pop culture franchises of all time.This is the story of that boy. The boy who never gave up. The boy who saved his superhero. The boy who loved Batman. Our society has been through a rough time, and now, more than ever, the world needs inspiration and hope through positive, uplifting stories. Michael’s memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman is the inspirational story that we need, that encourages people from all walks of life and of all ages to dream – and to dream big. This is the story about following your passion no matter the roadblocks, and to keep the faith while facing impossible odds. The Boy Who Loved Batman is a story about changing the world for the better – one comic book nerd at a time.Hearing Michael Uslan tell his story in person – with all the trials and tribulations he experienced over decades of struggling to make his dreams come true – is a rare privilege.He takes the listener on an emotional journey reminding us all what it means to dream, to struggle, to achieve. We want to give an audience the opportunity to feel the same energy and experience the excitement of his journey from comic book nerd to Executive Producer of one of the most successful film franchises of all time. Indeed, the Batman movies blazed the way for the entire phalanx of comic book-based films. Telling his story in a theatrical setting via a one-man stage play based on Michael Uslan's memoir is an amazing opportunity to bring some inspiration and uplift to the world. After all, theatre as an art-form allows young dreamers to follow their hearts. Don’t we owe it to them to bring them a story celebrating all the sacrifices they make to follow their dreams?BUT… PANDEMIC?While the COVID-19 pandemic crippled live theatre in 2020, Broadway announced it's reopening in September 2021, bringing performers and audiences back to Broadway for the first time in eighteen months. This will be an exciting revival of an entire industry, and our play about a dreamer who wouldn't say no mirrors what has happened to Broadway as an industry and to its artists. Being a part of this revival would not only be exciting, but would offer The Boy Who Loved Batman a unique launch pad as it takes off in this new form. The Boy Who Loved Batman is also uniquely positioned as a COVID-19 friendly show. First, it’s a one-man stage play, which minimizes the need for a packed house to sustain its budget. Second, one-man plays, by definition, have minimal crew and only one actor, so any current social distancing rules can be followed for the protection of all talent and behind-the-scenes crew. This also means that the show can be written, rehearsed, directed and previewed safely, with minimized fear of pandemic-related repercussions. Backing this project means joining Legion M behind the scenes as an amazing team of seasoned Broadway professionals develops the book into a live stage play, including:Bob Nederlander and Nederlander Worldwide Productions, LLCRobert Nederlander, Jr. is the president and CEO of Nederlander Worldwide Entertainment, part of the Nederlander family of companies which has been in the live entertainment business for over 109 years. Founded in 2000, NWE is focused on the expansion of the Broadway and Nederlander entertainment brands into new and emerging markets globally. Michael has producing credits on 80 films. The wallpaper will be portrait orientation, and it will fit most phone sizes. Mosaic is a sample; not final image.Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Silver BackerWhen you participate in the Vigilante Package, the Joker Package, The Utility Belt Package, & the Dark Knight Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Silver Backer! Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Gold BackerWhen you participate in the Bat Cave Package, the Daydreamer Package, or the Hero Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Gold Backer! Inclusion on the Thank You page of the website as a Platinum BackerWhen you participate in the Sidekick Package, the Killing Joke Package, the POW! Package, the Detective Package, or the Ultimate Hero Package, your name will be included on the Thank You page of the play’s eventual website as a Platinum Backer and be given the highest exposure and priority! Personal Video (Michael Uslan)Michael Uslan is not only a dreamer, but a doer and an icon! With the Hero Package, you will receive a personalized shoutout video from Michael Uslan addressed to you or someone you care about. Only 15 opportunities for backers!Invite to LA or NYC for early reading of playA once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! With the "Sidekick" Package, you will receive 2 tickets to a pre-opening reading of the play. These intimate readings are traditionally reserved for industry professionals and play investors only, and are used to tweak the content of the play as part of its early development process. By participating in this campaign, you will have the opportunity to get the "inside scoop" with a behind-the-scenes look! These readings are only taking place in New York & Los Angeles, travel expenses and lodging are not included. The New York reading is scheduled for two dates - June 29th & June 30th (subject to change). When you purchase NY reading tickets, you may be placed on either date. The LA reading is confirmed for Monday, July 19th 6:30pm-8:30pm PT at the historic Chinese Theatre in Hollywood. All backers will be required to sign an NDA prior to entrance and NO recording of any kind will be allowed. Proof of a COVID-19 vaccine will be required for entry. Early bird pricing available now with the "Sidekick" Package; ticket prices will rise closer to the events.Get feedback on your scriptThe Detective Package offers you the opportunity to have the Legion M development team read, evaluate, and provide you with in-depth notes for your screenplay, book, treatment or comic book, gaining feedback about your project from professional producers and writers in the industry. Project review will take up to six months to complete, and are subject to the availability of the executives giving direct feedback. This is only available for 10 total backers.1-hr Zoom with Legion M execsMaking it in Hollywood in hard! If you have burning questions about how to break into the business, or want to pick our brains about start-ups, Legion M's executive team will be happy to  give you some pointers! This business is all about who you know, so come get to know us! The Legion M Executive team is offering a very limited amount of these opportunities - only 10 total! 10-min zoom with Michael UslanTo celebrate the development of this pre-Broadway play, producer & writer Michael Uslan is offering the chance to have a chat with him about following your dreams and never giving up! In the Killing Joke Package, you'll get a 10 minute conversation with Michael Uslan to discuss his story of never taking no for an answer and making the impossible happen. Come be inspired. Only 20 spots available! Script signed by Michael UslanAt the Daydreamer Package level, you will be given a physical copy of the script of the play, signed by Michael Uslan! This item is extremely limited and will only be given to 100 total backers. The script will be printed, bound, and will be watermarked with each backer's name. Each backer must agree to sign an NDA before the script will be released to that backer. The timing of this release is at the sole discretion of the play's executive team and may be after the play premieres.Lunch with Michael Uslan (NY or LA only)Imagine having lunch with a billion-dollar feature film franchise producer in Hollywood -- NOW YOU CAN! Michael Uslan is giving the opportunity of a lifetime to only 4 total backers to sit down & chow down with him in either New York or Los Angeles. Dates are TBD and subject to Michael's availability. All lunch dates will be vetted prior to confirmation of meeting. No pitches please. Travel and lodging not included.BWLB Art Print (Mini Poster)You will receive an art print by one of our extremely talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story full of inspiration and courage. In an 11x17 size, this art print will be one to frame for your wall. BWLB Trade PaperbackMeet the man whose life-long quest to reclaim the true, cool soul of Batman wonderfully transformed today's comic book movies. Growing up outside Asbury Park, New Jersey, Michael Uslan was obsessed with comic books. He'd be the first to grab the latest issues off the shelves from his local comic book store, including four copies of the now legendary Fantastic Four #1. His favorite superhero was the brooding, crime-fighting vigilante, Batman. Despising the campy 1960s TV show, Uslan became determined to bring the real Batman—dark, serious, burdened by a tragic past—to the silver screen. Undeterred by Hollywood's initial lackluster response, after a ten-year human endurance contest in which every major movie studio turned him down, Uslan went on to become Executive Producer on every modern Batman film, beginning with Tim Burton's widely hailed Batman in 1989 to Christopher Nolan's celebrated Dark Knight trilogy and well beyond. Warmly told and inspiring, Uslan's remarkable story is a testament both to the profound imaginative power of comic book heroes and the tenacity of the New Jersey boy determined to bring one of them to life. This second edition includes a special foreword and afterword by Uslan, bringing us up to date on everything Batman.BWLB art print postcards (x4)You will receive four postcards, each featuring the art created by our talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story.BWLB Alt Mini Posters (x3)You will receive the other 3 art prints by all of our extremely talented artists based on their interpretation of Michael Uslan's story full of inspiration and courage. All will come in 11x17 sizes, perfect for your wall. BWLB Exclusive PinThis exclusive luxury enamel pin will feature art inspired by Michael Uslan's story of bravery and never giving up. Help us reach our stretch goals to unlock more perks! 
If we hit $25,000, it will unlock a t-shirt for anyone who contributed $250 or more and a discounted add-on price for everyone else. 
If we hit $50,000, it will unlock a surprise for all backers! 
*Note: Participating in this campaign does not constitute an investment into play based on the memoir The Boy Who Loved Batman, nor is it an investment into Legion M. To learn about how you can own a stake in Legion M, go to http://legionm.com/join-the-legion.Full disclosure… getting a show from concept to the Broadway stage is tough. Only a small percentage of plays developed for Broadway actually make it, and this play will be no exception. That’s why we’re stacking the team behind the project with superhero level individuals working tirelessly to do everything in their power to realize our collective dream. And while we cannot guarantee that the play will ultimately be mounted, all IndieGoGo perks outside of access to play tickets will be fulfilled.Dare to dream… and join us in this journey to Broadway!

story:
Voices From the Bridge

A Spolin technique Improv showcase addressing race relations. This show will allow the performers to share personal stories through theater. They will access the emotions in real-time, right before the audience's eyes. Theater allows us to explore hard themes and difficult truths. 

Our goals and your perks

Theater is an industry of varied professionals. On stage and off we depend on the skill and dedication of artists and technicians to proved the most dynamic experience for the audience. We have set our sights on Savannah Repertory's PLAYShop for our performance. The gifted technical support available there will ensure a great experience for our cast and our audience. We hope to reach out and bring more professionals to enhance this already stellar showcase. 

$25 You receive a special thanks in our program

$75 You receive a link to a live stream of the show

$150 You receive a signed poster

$250 You receive an exclusive behind the scenes look at the day of performance

$350 You receive a Tee Shirt

We are well aware that this past year has been a trying period for all of us. It was felt deeply by the theater community. But amid the pandemic there came an overwhelming awareness of the missing elements of our national conversation. It is our earnest hope to utilize the funds raised to reach as wide an audience as possible. To invite local community leaders, politicians, and civic organizations to join us in exploring the stories of individuals who are brave enough to share them. 

It's not just money we need

We know not everyone is in a position to donate, but we ask of those who cannot that they support us by sharing our fundraiser, the Indiegogo links, and any media we may produce concerning our show.

story:
Video: Shakespeare Downtown's Hamlet at Castle Clinton in 2019.  Directed by Geoffrey Horne. 

We hope you will be a part of the new Shakespeare theatre at Castle Clinton.

The mission of Shakespeare Downtown (SD) is to encourage an interest in classical theatre. By staging these free outdoor performances at Castle Clinton at The Battery, audience members experience the plays how they were originally done at Shakespeare's Globe Theatre 400 years ago: in the open-air, in the round, on the water. The actors wear period costumes and perform inside the castle walls where we create a theatre complete with chairs, audio, and lights.

In 2016, we produced Romeo and Juliet, in 2017, Richard III, in 2018, A Midsummer Night's Dream, and in 2019, Hamlet. Shakespeare Downtown will produce The Three Sisters from June 17-27, (Thursdays through Sundays) from 6:30 pm to 9:15 pm. Performances are free, and serve an audience of up to 250 each night, creating a truly accessible Shakespeare in the Park for Lower Manhattan.

Shakespeare Downtown evolved out of 10 years of successful productions. Geoffrey Horne, the director, is a founder of Shakespeare Downtown, and a long-time member of the Actors Studio. He has been an acting teacher at the Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute for over 35 years. He also worked as an actor in movies such as The Bridge on the River Kwai and Bonjour Tristesse, and in the theatre and television. Billie Andersson is the co-founder of Shakespeare Downtown, an actress, and producer of 15 plays. She is a graduate of Barnard, and studied acting at Strasberg, and with William Esper. Filmed excerpts of the plays can be seen at www.shakespearedowntown.org and at www.billieandersson.com.

We are working with the National Park Service, Downtown Alliance, Battery Park City Authority, the Battery Conservancy, and NYC & Company to spread the word about our free productions. In addition, New York Magazine, Time Out New York, The Observer, The Downtown Express, Tribeca Trib Online, and NY1 all promoted our past productions. Shakespeare Downtown was also featured on Fox 5's Good Day New York.

Well-known members of the acting community - Alec Baldwin, Estelle Parsons, John Douglas Thompson, Anna Strasberg, and the late Mike Nichols and Terence McNally have lent their names as supporters of Shakespeare Downtown. 

By supporting these free outdoor Shakespeare productions, you are helping to create the most accessible Shakespeare in the Park in New York City; and a new American Globe Theatre. Please join us in our endeavor! 

Why we need your help:
Individual donations show community support and help us build our audience. Every single dollar helps us get closer to our goal.

Other ways you can help:
If you can't contribute, you can still help. Please share this campaign with your friends and family.

You can make a difference.
Thank you in advance for your generous support!

story:
Overview

In this short film set to the song "Being Alive" from the 2006 revival of Stephen Sondheim’s musical comedy Company, contemporary dancer Nicholas Korkos will enlist his 15-year career to inhabit the character of Robert, a lifelong bachelor who, with the help of his many married friends, slowly, beautifully, painfully, metamorphoses from being a man closed off to the boundless possibilities of connection and commitment, into someone shouting, pleading, for the chance to finally love and be loved in return. Drawing inspiration from movie musicals like Chicago and Dreamgirls, Korkos and filmmakers Maya Pisciotto and Fabián Aguirre of the Understory, will take the raw, stand-alone nature of the song, and infuse color, glamour, and drama, heightening the already deeply emotional piece in ways only filmmaking can. 

 

What the Plan is and Why

While dance on Broadway has been heading in a contemporary direction for many years, this project pushes the genres together through contemporary ballet. A long history with Alonzo King’s LINES Ballet, the influence of the many contemporary choreographers throughout his career, and a rich upbringing in musical theatre, have all merged to form Korkos’ personal approach to dance-based performance.

Although dance is certainly a traditional element in musical theatre, there are few musicals where dance is the main attraction and even fewer dance centered iterations of shows originally created with no dance at all. And let’s be clear - we don’t blame them! Why would someone add another layer to a musical where the existing components already carry the show brilliantly? The only answer we can think of is because they know the unmatched, visceral power of dance.

The plan with Being Alive: A Dance Film is to first release it on YouTube for all to see, and then enter it into dance film festivals both nationally and internationally. Our initial goals in this venture aren’t exclusivity or profit but rather to initiate connection, widen accessibility and exposure, and above all, to entertain. 

 

A Little History

The original 1970 Broadway production of Company was a hit and as the climatic ballad, "Being Alive" remains one of Sondheim’s most recognizable songs to date. Both show and song strike the heart of anyone who has ever felt lost or alone. Company is for those who know what it’s like to struggle with intimacy, vulnerability, and a belief that their truest self will not be accepted. In other words, it’s a show for all of us.

Hi - Nick here! Thanks so much for considering joining our team. If you’ve watched our video or know me personally, you know I stutter. I’ve come a long way in my journey toward self-acceptance, but as a younger person trying to hide my differences, vulnerability and intimacy felt out of reach. It wasn’t until I got older that I realized the two are one and the same. Vulnerability is the only path to intimacy. Neither can be actualized without the other. 

Sharing our truest selves is the only path toward living a wholehearted life.

In 2006, at age 19, my best friend and I saw Raul Esparza as Robert in Company’s stark yet pulsating Broadway revival. To say the least, we were blown away. I had always identified with Robert’s longing, his desire for more than he felt able to give, but I felt in sync with Esparza’s portrayal in an unexplainably more personal way than the others I'd seen. Both he and Sondheim have an out of this world ability to hold back, to guard themselves until the very last second when the flood gates open and absolutely everything emerges.

It’s what any artist aspires to do: gather, sift through, build up, share. 

So, plain and simple, that’s what we are going to do. But – we desperately need your help! Nothing is quite as plain or simple as it sounds. I was ignorant to how expensive even short films can cost, but after speaking to multiple filmmakers and seeing it all written out, it became clear that the costs below are the bare minimum of what a high-quality film entails. Our goal is to raise $10,000. Now, I know that’s a lot of money, so I broke it down into specific categories below. Each donation will go toward one of three categories: production, equipment, and editing.

 

Budget Breakdown 

Preproduction, production, and equipment rentals (including three cameras and a lighting kit) come to $3,280. The theatre rental and house lighting designer come to a combined $1000. Our biggest cost is the editing process, simply because of the time required. Often painstakingly slow and specific, this cost comes to a total of 4,800. Combined with about $1,000 for a costume, production assistant, and food for the day, we’ll be just eking out at $10,000.

Other Ways to Help

Please share this campaign! The more support we have, the bigger our chance of making this film and sharing it with all of you becomes. In-kind donations, such as food or assistance on shoot day are appreciated as well.

 

Meet the Team

Professional dancer Nicholas Korkos has performed with Alonzo King LINES Ballet, Les Ballet Jazz de Montreal, Aszure Barton & Artists, Hubbard Street 2, Loni Landon Dance Project, San Francisco DanceWorks, Zhukov Dance Theatre, Robert Moses' KIN, project agora, tinypistol, Opera Omaha, San Francisco Opera and three times with the San Francisco Symphony, including a restaged version of On the Town with the original Broadway revival cast. In addition to performing, Korkos teaches and choreographs at various schools including the LINES Ballet School B.F.A. and Training programs and City Ballet School San Francisco. As a photographer, Korkos has photographed for Opera Philadelphia, the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra, Opera Parallèle, and various dance companies, and his work has been seen in numerous publications including The New York Times.

Founded by Fabián Aguirre and Maya Pisciotto, The Understory is a motion picture company dedicated to amplifying the mission of individuals and organizations who work to create impact as a force for good. By relying on the multidisciplinary language of film, our aim is to foster awareness, build community, and inspire action to address our most pressing social and environmental problems. We thrive at the intersection of non-fiction and narrative storytelling, weaving in and out and embracing the blurry line between the lens and the stage; science and art; poetry and fact.
